Reviews.Title: “Loveliest Hotel & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Josh M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at RC for three nights on our very first time to Venice and I must say... That the hotel was by far beyond my expectations! And the staff!!! OMG The staff is so helpful and with big bright smile on their faces! Room is great! The Lobby is very well designed and always clean and quiet... Nice music in the evening whilst sitting down iPading and drinking a beer :) It is not hard to walk from there to any of the major sites (faster than vaporetto) but you MUST enjoy walking and getting lost! My husband and I have told all our friends and family about this hotel and we can't wait to go back!!! Thank you guys for the best holidays ever! I am counting the days til my next holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the extra walk”
Reviews.Author: Carinablog
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Venice, so we were a little better prepared this time round. We therefore selected the Residenza because it seemed to represent excellent value for money as part of a trip booked through Lastminuit, and the location seemed somewhat intriguing. I researched its position online and emailed the hotel for precise directions. They replied promptly with a full list of alternative methods of reaching the hotel from the airport. We decided to catch a public No 5 bus, which runs from just outside the arrivals lounge to the main bus station in Venice, the Piazzal de Roma. It cost 5 euros each. From there we caught a waterbus to St Alvese. We purchased a 72 hour pass for 33 euros per person as we intended to use the vaperreto a great deal during our stay. When we arrived at the hotel we were impressed by the lobby and our room was plenty big enough for the three of us, in fact the double bed was absolutely huge! There was a nice clean bathroom and we overlooked a pretty courtyard. Some rooms overlooked the canal but we were happy with ours. We were offered a complimentary drink, which I thought was a really friendly touch. I liked the location as it seemed there were a great deal less tourist traps around, such as ghastly souvenir shops and restuarants serving suspect food. Instead the little shops and bistros were authentic and patronised by locals. Breakfast was a real surprise, as it far surpassed any other I have eaten in similar classed hotels. It was plentiful and there was lots of choice. I would therefore recommend this establishment without any reservations and hope to be able to return again one day soon. On the day we left my husbad asked the receptionist if we could buy the book which I had borrowed from the lobby and only half read, but he insisted that we took it as a gift....it doesn't sound much, but to me it's the little acts of generosity and friendliness which mark out one hotel from another.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet getaway in Venice close to lovely local tavernas, restaurants & cafes”
Reviews.Author: Panda9
Reviews.Content: We did not know anything about where to stay in Venice and it was our first trip. What a lovely surprise this little charming hotel was! There is a great little bar where you can have all sorts of drinks and cocktails made be a very friendly barman. The restaurant is open til late if you get stuck. Breakfasts have everything you could want from continential to full hot breakfast. Rooms are spacious, modern and clean. Best of all, it is located away from all the crazy tourist spots, so it is quiet, peaceful and enjoyable to walk around the area, where there are lots of locals with local tavernas (bars), restaurants and cafes. Location is also PERFECT as the airport boat stop is about 5 minutes walk from the hotel, catch a boat (rather than a bus) from the airport, it's very speedy and only takes about 30 mins. if you catch the bus it is about 30 minutes bus trip then add walking/vaporetto time etc plus it's not as nice. It is only about 20 minutes walk to St Mark's Square anyway. Make sure you get a day pass to travel on the vaporettos (you can buy them for 24, 48 and 72 hours etc depending on how long you stay). The nearest vaporetto stop is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel and so easy to use, just like the Paris Metro or the London underground, but by boat, so much nicer! That means you can get to all the sites by little ferry boat and no need to get lost on the streets of Venice (unless you want to of course, which is fun too)!.

Reviews.Title: “THIEVES IN VENICE”
Reviews.Author: Ian J
Reviews.Content: Whilst the Hotel was adequate I unfortunately left my Kindle on the bed. The Hotel inform me that it was not found. Shame that one of their staff is a thief.

Reviews.Title: “A confortable hotel far for the madding crowd.”
Reviews.Author: Guspos
Reviews.Content: This is a modern alternative hotel located 15 mins from rail station in the Cannaregio area. This is outside from main stream turistic routes but still in the centre of Venice. Pros: cleaness, location, breakfast, rooms, value. Cons: internet is not free (and really expensive too), last time I was there was something wrong with the heating system. Sill a truly recommendable destination.

Reviews.Title: “Avert nice stay in a quit part of the city”
Reviews.Author: alan r
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, with good facilities. Staff were very good, even when the coffee machine broke down the staff were running around to get coffee organised straight out of the kitchen. Good bar with a good selection of drinks. We asked for a canal view and got it. Be warned if you want the city sights outside your hotel then this is not the place. But if you want a comfortable hotel with all the services and quiet then this is the place. It took us 20 to 30 mins to wall to St Marco's sq. good enough. With all the noise of the arrival going on you want the peace at the end of the evening. We ate at several restaurants, Ostaria ! Acquisition Cartasi and Le Piramidi. All good. We did not have a bad meal over the 4day stay.

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mikeCambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: its a lovely hotel, nice big rooms, good bathrooms, good breakfast, very clean. it's in a very quiet corner, about a 20 minute walk down to the ponte vecchio / st marks sq, and there arent very many bars / restaurants within a 5 minute walk, but the hotel team were very helpful to suggest places to go. the only minor complaints were that there's free wifi in reception but not in the room and we could only find one power point in the room

Reviews.Title: “Great location away from centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Denny2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February for 3 nights. Quite a walk from the bus station but not a problem with wheeled suitcases. Very comfortable room, though the lighting was a little on the dark side. Good bathroom and shower. The buffet breakfast was excellent, bacon and eggs, fruit, cold meats, cheese, many kinds of breads and pastries. All in all an excellent place to stay to see all the sites of this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: joseph r
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at this hotel in the beginning of June. We found the simple double room facing the garden very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was very clean. We loved the decor and ambiance of the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Edwin_junior
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night. It was gorgeous. from entering the door, we could feel hospitality .what was amazing that the hotel upgraded our room to a garden suite. What a perk! The bed was comfortable and the breakfast was one of the best! Additionally, the hotel has nearest access to the water bus station linking to Murano island and 15 mins walking distance to the central railway station! It deserves it's ranking for sure. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to all of you!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gjv12474
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Cannaregio is a nice hotel. We stayed in a suite with 2 children and there was plenty of space. Its about a 20 minute walk to the centre of town which was fine for us. It was nice to be in a quiet neighborhood. Breakfast was average and the same everyday and no dinner service at the hotel. The bar is quite small but functional - note it closes at 11pm. We took the bus in from the airport, but highly suggest the direct boat to Cannaregio. You can then jump on the vaparetto and go two stops west and it is a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Note that the pull out sofa beds are very uncomfortable...

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying here”
Reviews.Author: Fiona O
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here in December. We had a "junior suite" which was stylish, roomy, comfortable and beautifully warm with a well-equipped bathroom, which was cleaned and re-equipped every day. The breakfast buffet offered a great variety and the panchetta bacon was really tasty. All the staff were friendly. The reception staff were incredibly welcoming, spoke excellent English, carried our cases to our room, gave us a useful map, recommended a lovely local restaurant and even phoned to make a reservation for us. There was a free drink in the hotel bar, too. We were very happy with the location in the quaint residential suburb of Cannaregio with its broad canalside walks, local shops and little bars. It was an easy walk or vaporetto ride to the major attractions. We reached the hotel from the airport by means of an Alilaguna boat to Madonna del Orto and then wheeled our suitcases along the canalside walks to the hotel, having previously downloaded a map of the location off the hotel website. We had booked the hotel as part of a budget low-season package, and we were amazed and delighted with the quality of the accommodation and service. It was real value for money. We would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location but great value, very quiet & clean, would stay in this hidden gem again!”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Life7979
Reviews.Content: I was expecting something dingy and dirty for the cheap $100 AMEX price, but to my suprise, the hotel was very clean, proivded comforts (soap, shampoo/conditioner, hair dryer, shower cap, etc.), and even gave us a free drink. The staff speaks English, is very friendly and helpful, and offered us a great map of the city. The lobby decor was modern and sleek. Our room decor was a little more dated, but we had 2 TV's, a large bed (that was 2 twins pushed together but nontheless nice), and an upstairs/downstairs unit. The only con I can say is that this hotel is out of the way & initially was very hard to find. Walking through the back alleys of Venice to get back to this hotel at night was scary. It's about a 15 minute walk to the train station, Venezia Santa Lucia. We passed maybe 30 hotels on our walk to this one, all of which looked decent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: UKAID
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true gem. Its within easy walking distance of all the major attractions. The hotel itself is extremely clean and decorated in a simple uncomplicated style. The staff can't do enough to help you and speak excellent English. Breakfast has a great selection of meats, cheeses, fruits, juices, cakes etc and will certainly set you the day. I certainly will return to this hotel if I decide to visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “We Just Keep Going Back”
Reviews.Author: CandSandColchester
Reviews.Content: Just return this morning from our 4th visit to this excellent hotel, a real find 5 years ago. What we love is that it is in a quiet, residencial and beautifully Venician area that makes like you feel like a part of the real city rather than just a tourist. A short walk from the main thoroughfare of Rio Tera San Leonardo with its shops and restaurants and adjacent to the old Campo del Ghetto plus only a 20min walk from the Piazzale Roma.There are also closer bars and family run resaurant along the canal from the hotel and while it is quiet the area is well lit and we always feel very safe. Infact this is an ideal base for walking anywhere on the island (and we are in our 50s!) a few mins from St Alvis plus 10 mins stroll from Fondamenta Nuove and the water bus to the islands of Cimitero, Murano & Burano (all done in a day). The hotel has a basically two different style rooms standard and suite, the latter having a mezzanine bedroom area but having had both they are both a very good standard thought the suite gives you more room. All rooms have a fridge, safe & hairdryer but no kettle or cups so take your own.The standard of decor is modern in an old building with lots of brick and wood so has a very comfortable feel. The bar is cosy and friendly and an ideal place to chat to the multi national guests about their days discoverys.The breakfast is superb, self service so ideal to set you up for the days sight seeing with hot and cold meats, cheeses, breads, cereal, cakes, tarts and drinks as much as you want. The staff are always happy to help and constantly filling trays with food. Finally this year, for the first time, we had a problem with a slight smell from the bathroom floor drain but on discussing it with the reception, all of whom seem multi-lingual, we were upgraded from a standard room to a suite for the remaining 3 nights. We have stayed in hotels on the Grand Canal, even overlooking the Rialto, but this is the one we keep coming back to. A bargain especially in November when we always go. hope to see you there. C&Sand

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HerthaBSCBerlin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for reasons of an anniversary for two nights in November 2011. The hotel was most pleasant and everything was perfect. Spacious room (canal view) well equipped, separate WC, nice bathroom. As many others have mentioned before: great breakfast, not just by Italian standards, but in general. We enjoyed the location at the far end of Cannaregio a lot because it felt like Venice of the Venetians, not the tourists. Easy to move around either by foot or by vaporetto (S.Alvise station is three minutes by foot).

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Town”
Reviews.Author: Telemachus_Jnr
Reviews.Content: What a place. An easy walk to the key sights of Venice but in the less touristy (and quiet) Cannaregio area of Venice. Hotel was superb with great rooms, friendly service, and very clean. Breakfast was decent start to the day and the restaurants in the area were excellent. Stayed in a canal suite, luckily the canal was not the Grand Canal and much more serene with a window in to more routine Venitian life. Back here for the next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: RichardAHWhite
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on our first trip to Venice for 30 years. A modern hotel in a residential area away from the centre, a pleasant 5 minute walk (provided the tide is not too high) from the Madonna Del l'Orto (don't miss the delightful church full of Tintoretto) stop for the Orange waterbus from the airport and the islands. 15 minutes to the Grand Canal. Breakfast only in October but good for that. Restaurants nearby are excellent - book early evening. The only complaint was that we booked an upgrade online which the hotel somehow managed not to process. Fortunately we noticed the difference before getting settled in. Not a good start

Reviews.Title: “worth every star”
Reviews.Author: colino762
Reviews.Content: the front desk staff were warm,friendly and welcoming, the room was clean and quiet, also a lot bigger than expected. breakfast was first rate, plenty of good food to choose from and fresh tea, coffee etc..... well worth a four star rating., happy to reccomend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: Rustiescot
Reviews.Content: Despite our visit being in February, we had a fabulous stay at this hotel. We loved the way it was off the beaten tourist routes but within a short walk of the vaporetto to take you anywhere in Venice.So quiet and surrounded by the houses of local Venetians, good value for money in a city with some typically outrageous accommodation prices.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel but far from tourist spots”
Reviews.Author: Guddi7780
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean with big rooms.Reception staff very friendly and service is good.Breakfast is ok.Only problem is its very far from tourist spots but its a quiet hotel.Highly recommended.Ask for canal view room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in quiet neibourhood. A walk to any of the sights.”
Reviews.Author: alexmaclennan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on our first trip to Venice. The hotel is in a quiet residential neibourhood. It is a 5 minute walk from the Madonna Del l'Orto stop for the Orange waterbus from the airport. Easy to find. Look for the Metal gates that bar your way on and the hotel is up the side street you have to walk on. Look for the wooden sign on the right. There is a supermarket 5 minutes past it. It is a 10 minute walk to the Fondamente Nuove stop for getting the LN to Burano and Torcello. 30 minutes walk to St Marks square. 20 minutes walk to Rialto. 10 minutes walk to Scalzi bridge. Quiet hotel. Helpful staff. Great breakfast, if you don't mind just scrambled eggs and bacon as the only cooked dishes. Good clean comfortable rooms. Small garden for relaxing or evening drink. All in all a good choice for a first hotel to stay in, if you don't mind (which we did not) a bit of a walk to the main sights in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “it had to happen once..”
Reviews.Author: scoi00
Reviews.Content: after all this years and hotels that finally I had to leave a hotel after the first night as it was impossible to stay longer. I do not have problems like other people reviewing this hotel with its location. Cannaregio is a beautiful part of original Venice where people still actually live . It's worth staying. But I have a problem with the attitude,service and ... heating .. of this hotel. We arrived at the reception just to hear that our "canal view" rooms had been upgraded to junior suite "garden view". We explained that we did not want "garden view" but our booked "canal view". They explained that junior suite were bigger and nicer but they could show us the "canal view" if we wanted. We said we wanted to see them . Then they suddenly told us that our "canal View" rooms had a water problem (strangely enough both) that's why we where "upgraded". We went to see the junior suites. Basically they are under the roof rooms with a mezzanine, with the bedroom watching the roof and the floor under watching the wall. The only window is on the stair and it's the only place that you could see something like a garden if you would move the curtains away. The room was so dark and so unappealing that we asked to be downgraded to a classic room where you actually could see outside. IN the evening after dinner we then just happened to hear a couple that just arrived at reception that still got a "canal view" room that they had reserved. Thanks ... It seems this all has a system. The hotel has only 9 "canal view" rooms. It seems that they love to "upgrade" the people to the weird garden view junior suites as not just airplane overbook. This is extremely nonprofessional . As for the rooms. It was impossible to turn the air-conditioning off . Yes there is a switch, but it does not work, it has to be turned off by the reception on the computer .. and .. it still does not work. At the end they came to the room just to see that it was just cold and there was no way to turn it off and we got blankets as they could not offer a heater. We two small kids we decided we had to change hotel (not to mention we where paying 400/euro a night for this mess). The Bar is amazing , they have a full menu of drinks but the bar keeper tells you that the only thing he can do and server is Spritz , white wine and red wine. Go figure. Calling this hotel a 4* is pushing it a bit. Rooms are standard 3* rooms, small , dark and nothing special . There are plenty of hotels in Venice that a far nicer and cheaper. If you still want to go to this hotel because they have a special make sure if you book a canal view room to specify not to "upgrade" you to garden view "junior suites"...

Reviews.Title: “Good property, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Alejandro-Vital
Reviews.Content: First to all, if you go to Residenza Cannaregio, look at the map were it is located because it is not on Via Cannaregio as they says in their web page. It is funny but after failling several times in finding the street we call the hotel and they explain us how to reach the property. Once there we found it was located in another street!! So, forget the street name, and look at their web to find the hotel. The neibour is quiet, but close to everithing (Venice in fact is not so big, you can reach almost any place after a short walk). The hotel is ok, clean and quiet. Breackfast is very very good! Unfortunatelly we have a couple of issues regarding service, first we were travelling with a baby, we requested a bay cot, but baby cot was not available (big mess for us!!), second Internet connection was not available, and their answer was... "it should be, but we do know what is happening! try it later...!" (later was the same answer!). Finally when we have to leave the hotel it was a national transport strike, so no vaporetto, no trains, etc. Nobody advice us on that, after being waiting the vaporetto for half an hour, we went back to the hotel and they explain us the problem! (we could save half an hour is they advice the problem at the check out), finally they refuced to call the train station to check our train status. Conclusion, nice property, very good breckfast, not so bad location, horrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Destination”
Reviews.Author: Teflon73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Residenza was the perfect location for our Honeymoon, we arrived on 29/05/2011 and stayed for 3 nights. The staff were friendy and helpful and room was lovely looking out on to the canal. It was about 20 mins walk to the more tourist areas , 30 mins from st Marks Square . Breakfast in the Hotel was a selection of hot and cold buffett style , very good for what we wanted , No food available for the evening but very nice Resteraunts 5 mins away with more reasonable prices than the ones closer to St Marks Square .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: Bonusme
Reviews.Content: Worst location ever on the outskirts of Venice proper, had to walk forever between unconnected waterways, room was not cleaning and not working

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venice,”
Reviews.Author: Lei14lo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Residenza Cannaregio used to be a monestary. It is located about 15 minutes away by a Gondola ride from San Marcos square. You can also uses the connecting bridges through Venice to reach San Marcos square, it took us at least one hour one day to het back to the hotel. IThe hotel is in a calm area of Venice. The Hotel is very beautiful, and serene. Two of my friends and I stayed in a Triple room with free breakfast. The room was large, comfortable. I know some Europe hotels are older and have a old world feel, but I prefer a modern feel with old warm charm which is exactly what i received from this Hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful with advice on directions, resturants and discussing history of Venice. When I go back to Venice I will stay here again. The breakfast was excellent. One thing I loved about Europe is there pastries the best in the world and this Hotel had great pastries. There was a TV in the room which also provided as a internet use. Was able to email family for a small price. Dinning room closed early. The bar open late. Very Very nice Hotel. Not too expensive for

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in a very quiet area of Venice”
Reviews.Author: robfromVancouver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very charming and in a nice area of Venice. A quiet refuge from the tourists of Venice. Its in a residential area close to Madonna del'Orto - the first stop on the boat from Marco Polo Airport - so ultra convenient. only a 10 minute easy walk with luggage from there. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. Breakfast that is included is good value and the staff is very helpful with recommendations, directions, etc. There are also some really good local eateries - try Osteria al Bacco - but avoid 40 Ladroni and Osteria del Maggio (food is not authentic and overpriced) Al bacco is great! Rooms are good value and the patio area is fantastic any time of the day or night for a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: brian_dhall
Reviews.Content: Far end of Venice but worth the walk, In the area are signs of fabulous architecture, schools, churches etc. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: babcu
Reviews.Content: Though it was a bit tricky to find the hotel, it was worth it. It's located in a quiet area in the Ghetto and about a 15 minute walk to the train station. The room was quite spacious and had two levels.. The sitting area, containing a sleep sofa, is on one level and the sleeping area is upstairs. The one downside was that the bathroom is located on the downstairs level, so in the middle of the night, if it's necessary to use the facilities, one has to go down the stairs. The staff was attentive and very informative. The breakfast room is well lit and the food is plentiful. I would highly recommend this hotel. A family of 4 can stay in one room. The value is great.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly off the beaten track but worth the effort.”
Reviews.Author: jonesfarm
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, tasteful, new conversion of a very old building. Slightly soulless but friendly knowledgeable staff make up for that.Excellent breakfast (hot and cold) and well worth the extra charge. Nice garden to breakfast in and take evening drinks. No other meals as competition from the plentiful nearby canal-side restaurants makes this probably not worth the effort. Appears initially to be a good walk from main sights but there is a canal taxi service to the hotel; the nearest Vaporetti stop is 10mins walk and the Grand Canal 15 mins walk. It is in a quieter part of Venice that has great charm and which otherwise might be missed. The only fault was the over-dimmed lights in my ground-floor room which made bedtime reading a little difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located in a quiet part of Venice, if only the rooms were better”
Reviews.Author: Ashtan
Reviews.Content: The hotels rooms were relatively bare and simple, economizing on everything from toiletries to towels. Front desk was very helpful and the breakfast service was quite good. Best we liked about the place was it's quiet serene location away from the crowded part of Venice

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: kaden
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The room was very spacious. We had a family room which is a bi-level. The breakfast was nice. If you don't get lost it is a 10 minute walk from the boat stop. The hotel staff was very professional and helpful. In fact, it was the best service that we had during our short stay in Venice. And they let us check in early with no problem. We were traveling with 3 small children.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, restful hotel in a residential area.”
Reviews.Author: BKMorgan
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, restful, clean, friendly, helpful, nice hotel. They have a bar that gives you a free drink on your arrival. We also had a very nice breakfast in the morning. It was a much needed break from the hustle & the crowds from the day. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and exotic”
Reviews.Author: FairCritics
Reviews.Content: We loved the location ,located within a quaint jewish ghetto,this hotel gave an entirely different flavour to our Venetian trip.It was like going back in time and we loved our daily walk through the streets here.The hotel by itself was adequate.We lived in a family room.The main bedroom beds were very comfortable however the childrens room wereas a bit cramped for space and the beds were not to comfortable.However in the final analysis we were happy there.The breakfast buffet was well stocked,and the hotel had an interesting bar and an open courtyard garden for sitting out.The rooms wre quiet and the hotel staff were friendly and helpfull.Add to that there was a very convenient local super market nearby.The gondoliers in the nearby canal charged much lesser than the St Mark square ones.It was a treat to sit on the nearby bridge over the canal after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bar and Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Nicola K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2011 with my boyfriend. Nice hotel, great bar and great breakfast. Only downside is the location. It is at the furthest point from St Marc's square on Venice Island. On a plus side it is the first stop on the Water Bus from the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the right boxes”
Reviews.Author: Girard5
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for 4 days in June 2011 and loved it. We`d read all the positive reviews and agree wholeheartedly. Very easy to access the rest of Venice and the islands and to get to and from the airport. Lovely, quiet location to escape back to after the rugby scrum which is the main tourist areas; especially sitting in the garden with a cold glass of wine. Wealth of local restaurants - out of the hotel, walk to the end of the street, over a bridge, turn left and wander along by a canal to take your pick. Staff were terribly polite and helpful. Breakfast got the thumbs up from my 15 year old and everywhere was very clean. Definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the busy-ness”
Reviews.Author: Rich_Bron
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Venice for the first time. The staff were friendl, room was massive and we were a 20 minute walk from the train station (St Lucia). We didn't have any tea or coffee facilities in our room and were told (as we were leaving) that you need to ask if you want to make use of them! What the?? Although we were not really impressed with Venice, this hotel was lovely and it was nice to stay away from the crowds (and expense) of St Marcos.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room & good service but not central”
Reviews.Author: B H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. It's not the old fashioned authentic Venice style type of hotel but more of the modern kind. What I liked most about our stay was the special room we had. It was quite modern with 2 floors. My kids could sleep downstairs by the entering level, while my wife and me has a double bed upstairs in a mezzanine. I stayed here for only one night because it was just a one night stay-over due to coming from a cruise and flying home the next day. The location of the hotel is not the best unless you don't mind walking a little bit to get to the center and the canal-boats. To get to the major canal-boats would take you about 5-10 minutes, but it's a nice area to walk in. One of the main shopping streets is at the same location as the canal-boats stops, so it's also only 5-10 minutes away. But I wouldn't recommend this hotel to people that have trouble walking/moving because of the walk you have to do to get to the center. That is, if you don't mind paying for boat taxis all the time there is no place better to stay since the boat taxis literally stop at a door by the reception. If you go to this hotel you should connect to the airport through the boat taxi stop a few squares away. This is one of the best parts of the location of this hotel. Forget all the hassle of getting to the entrance market to get buses etc for the airport and go directly by boat. Breakfast was quite good. All in all a very pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Venetian Treasure.”
Reviews.Author: ZigZagGuy
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cannaregio is an elegant and quiet hotel in a relaxing residential neighborhood well away from the frenetic madness of the open-air museum atmosphere of the rest of Venice. It's just a ten minute stroll to the Madonna dell'Orto vaporetto stop that connects directly to the airport. A Billa grocery store is less than five minutes away. The hotel's peaceful and beautiful courtyard is the perfect place to decompress after a day of combatting the crowds. It offers outstanding service, a superb breakfast and a charming bar (that offers a free welcome drink). The only negative is that free wifi is available only in the lobby. Look no further -- book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and nicely sited”
Reviews.Author: historyjak
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. It was quiet, set away from the throngs of the main city, but within easy walking distance. Like most hotels in Venice this one does not serve any meal other than breakfast, but there are plenty of restaurants and cafes around, as well as a supermarket within a few minutes walk. Breakfast was good, with plenty of choice and well-presented. The room was clean and quiet, with a lovely timber beamed ceiling. I would stay here again. A real benefit was the nearness of the ghetto and also Maria Del Orto.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: gogiandtom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very good location. ( I only gave it four stars because not everyone will want to stay in this far corner of Canneregio) with many very good restaurants nearby, the St. Alvise vaporetto stop only a five minute walk, and very QUIET. It is also quite convenient to the train station. The room was very large and comfortable. we had three persons, and were given a two level room with a queen bed downstairs and a king bed in the loft. The breakfast buffet was huge . Gabriele, at the front desk, was very welcoming and helpful. And to top it all off they offered a voucher for a free drink in their lovely bar. If you are looking for a comfortable and quiet place to stay in Venice, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, quiet hotel in a nice Venice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Zografiotis
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days there at the end of April 2011. The room was reasonably clean, the breakfast was also reasonable without being extraordinary. Professional staff; the neighborhood is nice, authentic Venetian, you get places where you mostly find Italians. The only annoying bit was the lack of wifi in the rooms, only in the reception area and then it does not work with iPhones/iPads for some inexplicable reason.

Reviews.Title: “calm & cosy”
Reviews.Author: Dasitrip
Reviews.Content: nice hotel in a very calm neighbourhood (not easily found in Venice). We stayed 4 days with our two teenagers during Easter holidays when there are many tourists. Our aim was to stay away from the masses, and it worked out well. There are still nice bars and gelaterie and ristoranti in the neighbourhood, on a small channel. Diana has good food and funny waiters. Breakfast was OK with a good choice. The bread was of poor (nutritional and taste) quality but that's the Italian or Spanish standard. The rooms are generous for a family of four, on two floors. Staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best honeymoon location for us”
Reviews.Author: Christyannme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Venice for our honeymoon. This hotel was located in a perfect location, quiet, near the local Venice life, a 20 min walk for the hectic tourist areas. The hotel staff was so helpful, and friendly. Rooms were clean with an interesting design. We paid a little extra to stay on the canal side, a good investment. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel adequately located in nice quiet part of Venice, but not quite living up to its stars”
Reviews.Author: pink_n_fluffy_NOT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a converted monastery and benefits from simple un-fussy decor and polite though impersonal service. One member of our party was promised a gluten-free breakfast, but this turned out to be a packet of wafers and a couple of packets of jam tarts. This was good, but for a four star hotel,we had hoped for a bit more effort especially as there is an excellent gluten-free grocery store a short walk away from the hotel. One night was spoilt by the hotel's noisy ventillation system which was as loud as an ocean liner and made for a poor night's sleep. A small colony of ants started in the bathroom and one ant ended up in our bed, no kidding!! Otherwise the rooms seemed quite clean. The plumbing was quite poor and some of the fixtures (including the electrical socket) drooped unhappily from the walls. When it came to paying the bill, we were first given someone else's mini-bar bill. Our own bill, in excess of one thousand Euros for two rooms, three nights made it hard to forgive these small indignities.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: Carrie0029
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a package deal with Easyjet. Checking in and out was easy and quick. The hotel staff were courteous, friendly and helpful at all times. The split level room was comfortable and extra pillows were supplied as soon as we requested them. This is an excellent base for anyone who enjoys a bit of peace and quiet after a hard day's sightseeing. It is a little way off the beaten track, but Venice is ideal for walkers and finding your way to and from the hotel is all part of the fun. The only thing we missed was tea and coffee making facilities in our bedroom. This was our first visit to Venice and it was useful to know that properties are numbered consecutively from 1 - this made finding the hotel a little easier. Even though we had checked out the location on Google Earth, the endless passages, canals and bridges can quickly get you disorientated. Again, all part of the fun. We were also glad that we had travelled light - our luggage consisted of a backpack each. We saw many, many tourists bumping cases on wheels over the bridges. Not many of the bridges have ramps so you should be prepared for lots of steps! The restaurant was only open for breakfast during this quiet time of the year, but there are plenty of places to eat locally. The 16 euro, 24 hour travel pass was excellent. We used this to visit Murano, Burano, Torcello and Lido, and this tour around the lagoon was probably the most memorable part of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: russ2000_uk
Reviews.Content: The location isn't the best for the main sights, but it's only 15-20 walk from all the main attractions and it's quite close to the main shopping district. In many ways, though, that is a benefit, because using services around the hotel means you can avoid the extortionate prices charged in the tourist hot-spots. Rooms were clean and tidy, staff were helpful and friendly and facilities were good. Not the best hotel I've stayed in, but good value for money and a good base to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: JamesShelley
Reviews.Content: Before we booked this hotel we read a few negative reviews in relation to the hotels location. Don't be put off, the location is ideal. It's a cute hotel that has a family run feel to it. The rooms are decent and the bar is nice and relaxed. The hotel is a 15 min walk from the train station and I felt that some of the best places to eat / drink / sightsee were in Cannaregio. The hotel also represents good value for money compared to one of the more touristy areas and allows you to mingle with and see real Venetians.

Reviews.Title: “A really good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tgw04
Reviews.Content: The staff in both the reception and the bar were very friendly and helpful. Check in was very smooth, as was leaving. The room was very clean and spacious, split on two levels, overlooked the canal and was very good value. All the areas of the hotel were very clean and well presented.The continental style breakfast provided plenty of choice each day. We dined out in the evenings so we did not try the dinner menu. The hotels location is in a quieter residential area which we found suited us perfectly.There were shops and retaurants and bars nearby which were pleasent and good value. It was probably only 10 minutes walk to the Grand Canal and 20 minutes to St Marks Square, but whenever we were out walking, the various sights, shops etc... made it hard to keep track of the time! A really good hotel which we will use again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay for a family”
Reviews.Author: chuckyzzz
Reviews.Content: We had three nights here as a family with teenagers and had a room with two opening windows on to a canal. The rooms were very clean and well equipped. The breakfast was amazing and could not be questioned on its quality and generous servings. The staff were efficient and our online booking well managed. Highly recommended to all. Very good value for money when for the time of year we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for famlies”
Reviews.Author: newyorker88
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 2 adults and 2 children. They have duplex family rooms with a staircase. Rooms were not fancy, but clean and everything you might need. The hotel is modern and breakfast was fine. We enjoyed our stay. The only drawback is the location which is just a little off the beaten track, which could also be a plus depending on whether you like crowds. It is not near St. Mark Square, but you can walk to the main drag in about 7 minutes and take the boat. A big plus is that the boat to Murano is very close to the hotel. Also, you can walk to the hotel from the train station easily with luggage. Overall, we had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “lvoely hotel, quiet, modern and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: debbyspero
Reviews.Content: we were looking for a hotel w/i a short walk from the Jewish Ghetto of Venice. this hotel was perfect: reasonably priced, very new and modern, spotlessly clean, with a wonderful staff. the hotel was quiet and altho the room (standard 2x) was a bit small, it was extremely comfortable. we spent our days walking around venice for 10 hrs at a time, and it was a pleasure to come back to this quiet, welcoming haven in beautiful venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be!”
Reviews.Author: ValentinaandSusanna
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a very nice part of Venice: quite but typical! Rooms are spacious and breakfast is rich! Really worth staying there!

Reviews.Title: “high standard, nice price”
Reviews.Author: bestfour
Reviews.Content: We took a family suite for 169â‚¬ the night which was best offer for four persons in Venice in June. Because of the room is about two floors, it is even suitable for two couples if you stay for one or two nights only. Bathroom was small but nice. View to the canal. Breakfast perfect, quite continental. Cannaregio seems to be the quarter in which most of the venecians live and is really quite. Walking to the center is possible within 10-15min. We found a cozy restaurant near the hotel and had a splendid evening. Staff was kind of snobby, could be friendlier, but was ok... After all, I can only recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location a bit off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: itnorluv
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cannaregio is located in the Cannaregio district of Venice, about a 30 minute pleasant walk through the winding streets of Venice to the main bus and train stations as well as to Piazza San Marco. The location provides for a quiet setting which reveals a feeling for the lived-in Venice, although it also requires stamina and/or increased cost for traveling to and from the hotel, especially with luggage or for early morning departures to the airport. Our double room (two twin beds) was spacious and clean although somewhat dark and with no view (only to a roof and wall). The bathroom was clean and included a shower/tub with side glass wall (a plus in European hotels). The tv received only one or two English channels and internet was available for an added fee. I was disappointed to be awoken one night to pouring rain on the loud roof as well as rain leaking significantly into the room around the skylight. The staff was generally courteous, although not overly friendly, nor did they go out of their way to make guests feel welcomed. BEST: quiet, authentic feeling location off the tourist path in Venice WORST: leaking roof, unfriendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a bit of a walk to the town center but overall good”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel201009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not easy to find but once we did it was great. The room was fantastic, overlooking the canal. It was sooo neat to wake up to the boats in the canal. Breakfast was delicious. I would stay here again, if I could find it again.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: alphadog63
Reviews.Content: For a supposed four star hotel, this was very disappointing. The restaurant is closed, the bar open only sometimes. The rooms are good size, but ours smelled of smoke. Overall the hotel is dark, and the rooms have a cave like feel. The location has pros and cons - pros are that you are where many locals live and eat, so prices are less expensive. However, the biggest con is how far you are from all of the major attractions. Be prepared for a long walk each day - you are a good 40 minutes away from San Marco. There is no charm here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: brianross8
Reviews.Content: We'd highly recommend this hotel. It was very clean and spacious and the staff were fantastic - very helpful and friendly. It was a bit difficult to find but I think that's the case for 99% of hotels in Venice! The breakfasts were very good, an excellent range of breads, cheeses, meats, fruits, teas, coffees, cereals and just about anything else you could think of. The hotel was also very clean and had a nice garden area to relax and have a drink in. It's also close to a port and a supermarket which is very handy. The hotel is in the jewish ghetto region - which is superb. It may seem a bit out of town but I can assure you, it's in a excellent location. It's actually only about 10 mins walk to the train station once you know the route! But after battling through the crowds in central Venice during the day you'll be glad to retreat to a slightly more relaxed part of the city. Also, the alleyways and canals around this hotel host some of the best restaurants in the city. We really can't speak highly enough of the area. If you book here you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bedbugs bite...”
Reviews.Author: Dust-E
Reviews.Content: Before I get into the meat and potatoes of this hotel, let's first go over some general pros and cons of the establishment. On the plus side, the hotel looks very nice. The lobby has an "African" theme and you can tell that much of the hotel has been newly renovated. The rooms are spacious, which you often do not find in European hotels, and the bathrooms are very nice. The breakfast bar in the morning is very good, probably the best part of this hotel. There is a large selection of foods, but hot and cold, and excellent coffee. The outdoor door garden is also another really nice perk to this hotel. Finally, what made my stay at this hotel worth all the bad that I'm about to tell you is the night manager at the front desk. I never caught his name, but I have never had a more friendly and helpful person working at a hotel in all my travels in Europe. The guy was amazing. This is where all the good stops though, I'm afraid. The restaurant was never open. I'm not sure why, but it wasn't. The bathtub didn't drain and someone had to be sent in to fix it. By fix it, I mean he simply tore out the metal stopper altogether, so that you no longer had the option of taking a bath, only showers. The day manager was horrible. Simply put, the man was rude. I'm not talking about the typical rude that you find with most European hotels, this guy was over the top rude. I think I could probably go on and on about how terrible he was, but I'll just end it with this; not at all helpful, didn't seem like he wanted to be there at all, didn't make you feel like you wanted to be there at all, just belligerent and benevolent. Finally, and this is probably the worst part: bedbugs. I noticed that I have a couple of bites that itched like crazy after the first night, but I attributed that to mosquitoes as I slept with the windows open. After the second night though, I was tore up. I have bites all over me now. Overall, this hotel is not worth staying at and why exactly it got such good reviews on here I'll never actually know. The location is terrible, you're on the exact opposite side of where you really want to be. The service during the day was severely lacking. Honestly people, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, resonably priced”
Reviews.Author: PogWicklow
Reviews.Content: Clean modern hotel situated about a 10 minute walk from centre of venice. Bit difficult to find as lots of small windy streets in venice and several bridges to carry suitcases over. Breakfast was good, scrambled eggs, ham, cheese and several cakes and fruit etc and on until 11am.. Only fault was no bar or restaurant open in the evening to even get a drink but several small restaurants were just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with very good website, much better than reality”
Reviews.Author: BelgianFamily-2-kids
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, with beatiful courtyard, we have distinct impression this once was a trendy hotel. No restaurant and bar anymore, international breakfast like you'll find in any city hotel, terras furniture definitively needs a clean up. We took suite with 4 beds, got poor canapÃ© for one kid though. Friendly staff replaced that immediately with descent bed. Airco with extreme temperatures >35Â°C doesn't cut it. A pitty. Don't look for them on Google maps or other, they are somewhere else... Near to campo Alvise on the outer North of Cannaregio zone. Check the taxi and public boat service before travelling to the hotel. It can save you time and money ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place :)”
Reviews.Author: MattS1985
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice at the end of the June as a 21st birthday present for my partner, booked through Thomas Cook i was a little apprehensive as this was the first holiday i'd been on where i would have to organise my own transfers! I came across the venicelink website and booked a shared transfer (50 Euros to take you to and from your hotel) and what a brilliant way to start your holiday, you get a real sense of arriving in style when you take this option that drops you at the private jetty of the hotel, well worth the money in my opinion and due to the ability to prebook it gives you peace of mind knowing your all sorted for arrival and getting back to the airport in time :) So onto Venice and the Hotel.............The hotel was beautiful and so quiet, the rooms were cleaned daily and all the staff we came across were very friendly and polite. For us the location was perfect being away from all the hustle and bustle of the more popular areas yet quite easily within walking distance from these places. We didnt use any public transport once out there, choosing to walk everywhere which is suprisingly quick and allows you to take in the lovelyness of this amazing city. Overall an amazing short break which i would recommend to anyone :)

Reviews.Title: “Business and Leisure well catered for”
Reviews.Author: Cathg1g2
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a lovely quiet location of Venice but with easy access via foot or vaporetto to all of Venice's beautiful sites. An oasis in the middle of the day from the crowds of San Marco. Business meant we needed to get to St Lucia station early and we had the convenience and ease with this hotel and made our way via picturesque routes on foot. Located in a area with access to bars and restaurants serving delicious food and drinks and great atmosphere by the canal. It was wonderful to get caught up in the locals enthusiasm for the World Cup! Breakfast was generous and delicious and the courtyard was pretty and a nice way to start the day. Ideal if you do not need to be in the centre of the tourist buzz.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: demdecruz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 10th anniversary trip and we were not disappointed. The room was spacious and clean, plenty of hot water and air conditioning. The room overlooked a beautiful courtyard garden and the windows were long enough to sit by and feel as though you were outside yourself, ahh... I can still remember the pleasant fragrance of jasmine which climbs the walls - counteracting the smell of tobacco from my husband - possibly the last smoker in the world! Breakfast was a leisurely experience - open till 11am and was a full buffet, eggs, bacon, toast, rolls, cheeses and cold meats, cereal and fruit etc. The location was perfect for us, 20mins by water bus from the airport (Alilaguna waterbus orange route to first stop - Madonna del Orto) and then a 10 min walk through beautiful residential squares and waterways to the hotel at the end of a quiet canal. The walk to Rialto and San Marco square took approx 25mins, possibly longer due to there being too much beauty to stare at along the way! After battling with your fellow tourists, it was a relief to meander back to the hotel and rest before going to one of the restaurants/bars that are near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: dar268
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in early-June 2010. We really liked the hotel and Venice is fantabulous. The hotel's a little away from the centre (a 30 minute stroll to St Mark's Sq) but we really liked being away from the crowds and tourist traps, This does mean that it is not suitable for those unable or unwilling to walk a little. The room was spacious and clean and the breakfast was very good. The hotel wasn't cheap but better value than a number of alternatives. It was fairly easy to get to the hotel from the airport - number 5 bus to Pisella de Roma (2 an hour) and then 42 or 52 vaporetta (very frequent) to San Alvise from the furthest vaporetta stop on the left. It's only a short walk from San Alvise though not completely obvious to find first time. Some Venice tips: - Better to go slightly off season (early June was perfect temperature wise), - Venice is expensive but not as bad as I was led to believe (especially staying away from the centre), - Buy a travel card from the airport - it was E33 for a 3 day pass which covered all transport (bus and boat). My partner only paid E18 as he is under 29. - The vaporetta is the way to get around town. They're pretty frequent and an experience in themselves. - Gondolas are expensive! Unless you have money to burn, better if you can pool with others. - Visit the Doge's Palace and book the Secret Rooms tour in advance - it's cracking. - The Lido is nice for a few hours by the beach, - Eat lashings of ice cream, drink and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms-nice quiet part of town a mere 10min from Venetian mayhem!”
Reviews.Author: IrishRoadTrip
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and rooms were maintained impeccably.Decor is rustic but with a modern slant; interiors and colours are very calming.The location is off the beaten track but we found this to be an advantage as it was very quiet at night.And it was only a small walk to the heart of the tourist area.The only problem we had was that the Google map for the hotel was completely wrong and we'd have never found it but for the helpfulness of the locals.Also the normal rate for the room is a little high but we got a special deal with lastminute.ie for staying 3 nights so it was definitely worth it for how nice the hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel - far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: meg2010Madrid
Reviews.Content: Despite the hotel is located a little bit too far from the city centre, it was worth the stay. I went with my boyfriend and stayed there for 4 nights, the hotel is very clean and modern , the staff really nice, rooms are big and confortable , great breakfast. If you are an older couple and are not willing to walk everyday for 25 minutos to get to piazza san marcos..dont stay there. if you enjoy walking in a beautiful city , i would definitely recomend this hotel. In my next visit to venezia, i will probably stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: Second year in a row we've stayed here. Again very enjoyable. Quiet location, but only minutes on foot or water from main sights. Very reasonable breakfast included in price, including eggs and bacon. Worth considering for a Venice trip.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel away from tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: happymanTelford
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives you a real flavour of what Venice is like. It is away from the tourist areas,and you are amongst the local people, with lovely bars and restaurants around with prices which are lower than the main areas. A really lovely place -- thanks to previous reviewers for the information. Yes the bar and restaurant weren't open, except for the very enjoyable breakfast, but with the area having many places to eat and drink locally, we probably wouldn't have used it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel away from center of Venice”
Reviews.Author: ZikLila
Reviews.Content: Venice was cold the day we arrived making each vaporetto ride a literally thrilling experience. This pink hotel near San Alvise vaporetto stop, however, was a pretty interesting place to stay at. # Transportation: From the Marco Polo airport, you can take a bus to Piazalle Roma. Then take a vaporetto to San Alvise stop. (Ask the tourist information/bus information desk at both places for the exact numbers of the bus/vaporetto.) Once you get off the San Alvise stop, it's a short walk away with several turns from the hotel. This might be a bit confusing if you arrive at night or when there is nobody else around to ask for directions. The hotel is not right in the center of Venice, but if you like some place nice and quiet outside of the main tourist attraction, this hotel is it. # Amenities: very nice bathroom with good products (try the shower gel... it smells divine!) The room was not too big, not too small, really nice with very large windows and beautiful wood decor. # Wifi: wifi is NOT included. 1 hour = 4 euro; 4 hours = 7 euro. We paid for the 4-hour access. # Breakfast: nice selection of ham, salami, cheese, croissant, cakes, yogurt, fruits, orange juices, milk, etc. For me, food and drinks were really good. # Staff: this is where I got mixed experience. We met with three staff members. The first one was a very nice guy who went out of his way to help us with fixing the wifi. The second one was another nice guy who lent us an adapter since we were short of one. The third one whom we met the morning we left the hotel on 09-Mar was a straightforward Italian guy who, when I asked to borrow the phone to call my hotel in Rome, responded, "Borrow? Nothing is free here, you know that." He later on did let me borrow the phone but was not enthusiastic at all with helping me to connect through, so I ended up not being able to make that phone call. To that third staff member if you ever read this: I do know that almost nothing in life is free. I also believe that there are many ways to convey that message. The attitude you gave me was appropriate given that I was a customer at your hotel. If the call were indeed not free, you could have told me something like this, "I just want to let you know that a phone call to Rome would cost xyz euro. Would you like to make the call?" Or you could have just replied with a nice yes and helped me with making that simple call. I didn't give you an attitude back nor did I contact management because my overall stay up until that morning was pleasant and I didn't want to ruin my experience any further. I'm not sure if you were being rude or it was your style of humor. If it were the first, I hope you'll learn that while nothing in life is free, kindness doesn't hurt and rudeness doesn't help. If if were the second, I must tell you, it is not funny. Don't tell the kind of jokes that can make you lose your job.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Venetian neighbourhood experience”
Reviews.Author: Mimi_ABroad
Reviews.Content: Residenza was in an excellent location off the beaten path, and close enough from the bus station to walk with rolling luggage. You avoid the crowds in this area, its nice and quiet at night, yet have enough choice close by for shops, food, sites, etc. Bus stop is close and S. Mark's Square is 25 min walk, and you'll enjoy the walk. The front desk guy is a gem. Ask him for a map and some restaurant recommendations.... Its great! Rooms are spacious and clean, get one on the canal if you can. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “large, quiet rooms, slightly off the beaten beaten path.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel_whoohoo
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were surprisingly very large with full shower, separate room for toilet, large counter space/open closet area. Bed was very firm (not my preference). Style is modern. Breakfast was excellent with hot foods (bacon, eggs), tea, coffee. Restaurant and bar not open when we were there but may be due to off season. This hotel is off the beaten path so always took at leaast 15 minutes to walk to our destinations but I loved walking through Venice anyway so didn't mind the location as some others may.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel,really.....?”
Reviews.Author: flugel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the residenza for four nights. Pros The hotel was clean and nicely decorated. Our room was large . The breakfast was good, with a wide selection of food. Cons no bar no restaurant (their explanation was, that they had recently been taken over and were still sorting everything out. They were bought out in March.....) no tea or coffee making facilities. The heating system was noisy and wouldnt stay at the temperature i tried to set it at. Would love to know how they consider themselves four star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiP
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there for 3 nights a couple of months ago.. Very nice 4-star hotel with clean charming rooms, lovely breakfast and very helpful front desk staff. The hotel is located in very quite part of Venice, on a 15 min walk to the St. Lucia train station. There is a very convenient water bus stop near by. Perfect value for the money, especially for old Venice. The only disadvantage was that the restaurant was temporary closed.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: averygosh
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly clean, the staff friendly and helpful, top grade bathroom products. We stayed in a suite with a double bed upstairs and a sofa bed downstairs. Two televisions, lots of room for a Venetian hotel. Slightly out of the way, but calm, close to the vaporetto and to the ghetto. An incredible value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, but no atmosphere because bar remainded closed.”
Reviews.Author: didinic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money & easy to get to from the airport, would recommened getting the airport boat service for 13 Euro takes 20 mins get off at the first stop Madonna Del Orto & then wait for the no 41 or 51 boat at the same stop for St. Alvise where you get off & the hotel is 5 mins walk from there. We were greeted warmly & checked in promptely, nice comfortable rooms but we couldn't switch our air con off & had to ask at reception which still didn't work ( it kept coming on & off!) & was eventually told to switch it off by the main trip switch in the room! Breakfast is ok, but basic, ok if you like ham & cheese sandwiches followed by a choice of cakes! Our main complaint was that the hotel bar remained closed for the entire stay, which i was half expecting because i'd read reviews on here saying the same thing, because of this the hotel lacked any great atmosphere & the restaurant Al Piron was also closed. Shame as it can't cost that much to staff a small hotel bar for a few hours a day. Close by restaurants & bars, although we didn't once have what you'd call an outstanding meal anywhere, which was very dissapointing. La Piscina attached to La Calcina hotel in Dorsoduro was nice but quite expensive,( like everything though in Venice!) however a lovely setting looking out over the waterfront, & the food & wine we had was very good quality. We purchased a 72 hr ACTV pass for our stay which was good value for money & lets you hop on & off all the water buses (vaporettos & moscofati), as the hotel is only in a good location if you don't mind some walking, ie; 5-10 min walk to the nearest stop to get into main part of Venice (Guglie or S. Marcoula)We used these also to get the no5 bus from Piazzelle Roma to the airport on the return. None of the negative comments i've made should take away from the fact that Venice is one beautiful & enchanting place to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous spot away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: AustPrincess
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that I found very last minute and didn't regret my decision at all! My fiancÃ© and I travelled to Venice for a late birthday weekend and I found this hotel online and after reading some reviews took a punt. It was great. It wasn't the easiest to find and I think they could provide a little map to make it a little easier. That said, we didn't struggle for hours, it only took about 15 mins to find and it was never an issue after that. We weren't interested in using the hotel restaurant or bar, so I can't comment on what. But the room was great, and the breakfast provided each day was more than adequate. The Rialto is about a 30 min walk away from hotel through some lovely streets and I really enjoyed being a part of everyday Venetian life! There is a fabulous little wine bar La Cantina on the way to the Rialto that we stopped in and went back again a second night because it was great and incredibly affordable. The wine was divine, the food platter amazing and the staff entertaining. Seek it out if you can. Either way, this hotel is perfectly positioned and offered great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Happiness”
Reviews.Author: NoNoNannette
Reviews.Content: Great, quiet locale. Spartan, comfy rooms. Kind, courteous staff. WONDERFUL low price.

Reviews.Title: “The lovely Residenza”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsTrolleydolly
Reviews.Content: The hotel Residenza Cannaregio is a nice medium sized 4* hotel recently refurbished into a beautiful modern 2-storey hotel. It is situated in Cannaregio an authentic traditional part of Venice right next to the Campo De Gheto Novo, which is the oldest Jewish settlement in Europe. FIRST IMPRESSIONSâ€¦ The hotel is at the of a long narrow street. It has quite a small entrance that opens up into a big wonderful reception area. There are 4 steps into the reception area. Once your inside you are faced with a large open space, which is quite a surprise as the front looks so small. The floors are all marble & the ceiling is made from wooden beams. The large reception desk is on the right hand side & then there is a lovely seating area to the left, which has several leather chairs & sofas. The hotel is very peaceful & quiet. If you walk straight through the reception area you have the bar on your left & the ground floor rooms round. Around the corner you will find the breakfast room & the pretty tranquil Venetian garden. THE RECEPTION The hotel has a large reception, which usually has about 3 receptionists working. Most of them speak very good English & can help with any questions or queries. THE BEDROOMS Altogether the hotel has 66 rooms spread over 2 floors. On the ground floor there are a selection of twin rooms & 4 single rooms. The first floor is where all the family rooms & suites are so if anyone had walking difficulties or liked to be on the ground floor that would be no problem. Due to this the hotel doesn't have a lift, which really doesn't matter. All the rooms are sort of inter connecting I am not sure why but it is good for families with children that are possibly too young to be on their own. If people are not travelling together & are in a connecting room this is not a problem though if that's what your thinking. The connect by both having a key to the one front door & once your in there is 2 separate doors one to each room. Quite weird but as I said good if you're a family or even friends. All the rooms are looking out on to the Venetian garden & are double-glazed so they are pretty sound proof as it isn't really a noisy area anyway. The rooms all have air conditioning, mini bar, direct dial telephone, safe & television. The television I also able to connect to the internet so you can check your emails for a small charge I am not sure how much as I didn't bother & I don't think many people do but it was nice to have access just in case. The TV also had the usual English pay per view movies. You cant get away from paying for your movies or surfing the because the TV is monitored & the reception send you a nice bill the following day. You need to pay in Euros. Out of the 66 rooms 54 of them have baths in which is good as in most hotels you have to put up with a grotty make shift shower. The bathrooms are big & airy the floor is marble & there is a large mirror in there to make it look like the bathroom is really big. The bathrooms have complimentary soap, shampoo, and conditioner & shower cap. All the rooms have 2 large windows & are decorated with dark blue & orange bed covers & matching curtains with neutral coloured carpets. The ceilings all have wooden beams on to give the old yet modern feel. They certainly have the wow factor. The family rooms are either 3 or 4 bedded & have like a split level room they are very trendy & attractive with either a twin or a double bed on the first floor & then there is a mezzanine level with a further double or single bed. They are not tiny by all means they are probably just a big bigger than the average sized twin. THE BREAKFAST ROOM There is a large breakfast room on the ground level, which serves a continental cold breakfast buffet style from 07:30am - 10:00am, which is quite traditional for Italian hotels. The usual choices are cereal, fruit, ham & bread, toast & croissants & yoghurt. All guests have the option of eating in the breakfast room or in the gorgeous Venetian garden as long as it isn't raining! The breakfast room has plenty of tables & you can sit on a 2 table or a 4 table but I am sure if you wanted a bigger table the waiter would arrange that for you. As this hotel only offers a bed & breakfast stay you can either eat out at night or you can go to the breakfast room in which you will find has been transformed into an up market gourmet restaurant. You can expect to buy a meal in her for about Â£30 for 2. I personally didn't eat here but it all looked very nice & they served typical Italian dishes pasta or lasagne then meat or fish & then a nice dessert it was different most night though. The breakfast room is very trendy & has nice comfy modern furniture, it doesn't have many windows but there are lots of lights so it is nice & bright. There I a large door at the back of the restaurant which leads out on to the decking in the garden where there are several table & chairs so people can dine outside. THE BAR The bar is close to the reception & breakfast room it is very modern & is situated in a large alcove. The bar is well equipped for any occasion & there are 6 wooden stools at the bar it is quite long sop there are usually 2 bar tenders. The seating area is an adequate size there are about 8 tables with 4 chairs around each of them. On each table there is a small piece of modern art which is very eye catching on one there is shapes out of pencils another there is a bunch of shells & another was a structure of straws. You can order drinks at the bar or with the waiter As guests mainly stay at this hotel on a Bed & breakfast basis the bar also serves light snacks at lunchtimes. The bar closes at midnight. THE GARDEN This Venetian style garden really is the hotels selling point. It is situated in the middle of the square shaped hotel. It is quite narrow but very long & is a real suntrap. There are a few small seat areas with tables & about 4 benches down each side. The garden is very tranquil & extremely peaceful. It is the perfect place for reading or just a nice place to sit & relax. The one thing I loved about the garden was that it smelt gorgeous it was full of all different herbs & spices & pretty flowers & shrubs. THE DÃ‰COR The dÃ©cor at this hotel really sets it aside from all the other hotels in Venice it is amazing. Everywhere you look there is a magnificent work of art either in the form of a weird & wacky sculpture or a huge brightly coloured painting. The hotel has a modern sophisticated feel throughout. There are also lots of plants dotted around the place & everything just looks like a complete work of art. The restaurant & bar area all have ceilings made of wooden beams & some of the walls are exposed brick, which makes the whole building stylish & very modern. GETTING AROUND The hotel Residenza Cannaregio has its only private access to the Gondolas, water taxis & water bus on St Alvise canal just a couple of feet away from the hotel entrance. This is good as you can take a water taxi from the airport for about Â£60, which isn't bad, & I really think it's the only way you should go in & out of Venice. The Residenza Cannnaregio is actually in the Ghetto part of Italy & is a bit of a walk from the centre. It takes about 20 mins on foot to get to the Rialto Bridge & St Marks Square. PRICES To stay here on a bed & breakfast basis per night in a twin room you are looking at about Â£60 in the low season & Â£200 in the high season & about Â£55 in the low season for a single room & Â£175 in the high season. OVERALL COMMENTS I think this has got to be one of the best hotels in Venice where it lacks in location it certainly makes up for in comfort & modern surroundings. The staff are all friendly very smiley & the rooms are all spotless. If you where going to visit Venice this hotel should defiantly be some where to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Superb modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoolCaro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Residenzia Cannaregio. A beautiful modern hotel in a historic building. Unusual to get such modern surroundings in Venice. Relatively good value for Venice too, presumably as it is away from main tourist centre. Being a bit out of the way was a great advantage as it was relaxing and we were able to sit and enjoy peaceful delicious dinners along the nearby canals without going into the overly touristy areas of Venice. Good tourist sites in immediate vicinity e.g. the original ghetto, Tinteretto's house and some interesting churches. V close to S' Alvise vaporetto stop and walking distance to Fundamenta Nove stop for the airport boats and the station for trains (if you don't have masses of heavy luggage!). Hotel buffet breakfast quite good and staff very helpful. Location lovely and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hayterbankfell
Reviews.Content: Room clean and serviced daily - but this is certainly not a 3/4 star Hotel. During our entire stay (4 Nights) the bar and restaurant were never open. we booked out on a thursday morning and returned later to pick up luggage - we were not able to get even a glass of water. Reception staff told us to get a drink from room mini bar!! Our room had been vacated earlier -Not Acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but bad location”
Reviews.Author: n2c2e
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night. The rooms were clean, the decor was very modern (loft style). The bathrooms were well fitted. The front desk seemed helpful, although we did not really make any out of the ordinary demands on them. The breakfast was good with a pretty big spread. The location is a bit out of the way. You need to take a vaporetto to S'Alvise stop and then walk about 5 minutes to get to this place. If you have a heavy suitcase, this walk is kind of hard since it involves walking over a bridge. Also, if you arrive late (around 10pm), there are very few restaurants open around this area.

Reviews.Title: “great location for shopping and getting to know venice”
Reviews.Author: naiviv1071
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Venice. I visited before as part of a group tour and stayed in the San Marco plaza. This time around I elected to stay in Cannaregio after doing some research on this site. I was not dissapointed. We took a vapporetto to the St Alvise stop. We had a lot of luggage so I do not recommend you do this. If you are carrying a lot of luggage and can afford a water taxi, then do so. They will leave right a the door of the hotel. The room had a loft, so two of us stayed in the two double beds and another slept on the sofa bed on the bottom floor. Breakfast was also very good. The staff was helpful. Great location for shopping for souveniers and tasting local food. We arrived at 11 am and were too early to check in but they let us drop off our bags. We had to pick up two friends at the train station, so we headed towards the SMN station. One the way there, the streets are lined with local restaurants, pizzerias, grocery stores, souvenier shops. We checked out the menu prices and knew we could afford to eat here for sure. The weather was awful, rainy and cold. We saw a consignment store and bought sweaters for 5 Euros. We had the best time in Cannaregio, bad weather and all. As for visiting the rest of Venice, we bought 2-day passes and visited San Marco and Burano on the Vaporettos. I would stay here again. It is a great starting point and you are forced to see the real Venice and not just the touristy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: scampiman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residenza April 2009 and had a lovely stay would agree the coffee is undrinkable but does not spoil the stay.Breakfast was fine fresh croissants and the usual continental fare I think people expect to have a full blown english breakfast you are in Europe for pity's sake! Bedrooms are spacious and clean with all you need for an enjoyable break,reception staff were very helpful with any questions.We arrived late and they pointed us in the right direction for some food. They operate a free water taxi to Marano to a glass factory (yes they probably get a kick back ) but go on the tour you don't get any pressure to buy and then get the vaperetto back well worthwhile for the free experience of a water taxi ride. Good restaurants nearby we tried 40 Lodrini and this was superb and would highly reccommend. Hotel is away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk or take vaperetto to sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good, needs some more effort”
Reviews.Author: RaniaK
Reviews.Content: Location: Great location if you do not want to be exactly in the center. Nice places to walk around, my 6 years old daughter enjoyed playing in the ghetto nuovo square (5 minutes from hotel). Cheap bars to have something beside the small canals.
