Room: The family room was a two storey which has been prooven very difficult. Also, no place to hang ones coats, or to open ones luggage. Nice yard (for the small Venice hotel standards) to sit outside in the sun or a nice evening. Breakfast: Average to poor. As far as coffee is concerned, it was really bad. Prices: booking.com had price that was good value for money. Internet is not free.

Reviews.Title: “POOR VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: randaragna
Reviews.Content: room clean, rather dark, empty, with strange and ugly plastic furniture. bathroom small good, quiet location expensive restaurant breakfast with lots of different food, all of poor quality, including the coffee. certainly not a four star hotel. very poor value for money

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing + Mediocre could do a lot better”
Reviews.Author: Traveller-chris1
Reviews.Content: Very minimalistic hotel, Bed was very hard room was cold and heating did not work, Had to ask twice for more blankets and pillows, Some reception staff unhelpfull when asked for more hangers as we found 7 trouser hangers and only 2 shirt hangers in the room i was told at first that was all they had available and a shrug of the shoulders but after pressuring them they eventually and begrudgingly went and found some more shirt hangers for me. minimalist hotels look nice and tidy until you try to unpack your luggage then it always looks a mess !! as everything is on show. Nice location off the beaten track, Breakfast nothing to write home about either as a poor choice of food in my opinion 1 ham, 1 Salami, 1 pocessed plastic cheese slice cold scrambled eggs, altogether a bit dissapointing really as other reviews raved about the place, it could have been a different hotel or the reviewers were not used to the class of hotel this claims to be. i would not return

Reviews.Title: “very nice and clean hotel but communication with guests needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: depal
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights there last summer and I must say that I enjoyed it very much.nice location ,good service.A lot of space in our suite for 3, will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the coffee!”
Reviews.Author: malvern09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked well away from the tourist drag - which means nice and quiet. It also means quite a lot of walking to get to most things, but I'm sure most people would be aware of this before they booked. (Although it is very near the stop for the airport waterbus - the Alilaguna 'Orange' line). Unlike many hotels in Venice which go overboard on 'classic' heavy Venetian fabrics and decoration, the decor here was modern (although in a very old building) and comfortable. Friendly staff, nice rooms. Our only real complaint was the coffee at breakfast - instant, and usually lukewarm. How can a 4* hotel, in a country which prides itself on its coffee, serve that? However, hardly enough of a problem to stop us returning. Also tried the restaurant Au Piron (which seems to be run as a separate business). Nice enough if you just want to flop at the hotel, but there are better cheaper eats around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great food”
Reviews.Author: Larry_Braverman
Reviews.Content: I have only good things to say about this hotel. Away from the Grand Canal, but only a short boat ride or a nice walk if you have time and the inclination. My wife and I had an excellent dinner at the hotel followed by a evening gondola ride. Was my favorite night of the trip. I would highly recommend the after-dark gondola ride... definitely worth the extra expense.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jscudieri
Reviews.Content: After searching for a long time I came to pick this hotel. The price was great and location was great. It is off the beaten path so you do not have a crowd around and that makes it nice and quiet. But at the same time it is only a two min walk to a water bus stop so easy to get to places. We had an upgraded room with a loft bedroom and a separate sitting room. The room is nice and big gives you that nice seating area to relax when you get back from walking around all day. The room was very clean. The room came with a breakfast every morning that was very good. It had an assortment of pastries, yogurts, breads, even had some hot items. We found the hotel to be very nice and well kept. Staff was very courteous and helpful. I would definitely tell anyone traveling to Venice to stay with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Teri2512Stafford
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel set in the quiet residential area of Cannaregio. A 10 minute walk from Madonna Dell Orto stop. Due to unforseen circumstances we were advised on arrival that the hotel had a technical problem and that they had arranged a different hotel for us not far away and the same class. This being the Bellini (I have left a review of this hotel also). The helpful receptionist ordered us a taxi (courtesy of the hotel) and provided us with a free drink whilst we waited in the lovely courtyard for the taxi to arrive. On first impressions the hotel is clean and well ran. Unfortunately we didn't get to see anything other than the foyer, bar and courtyard. Although changes were made to our venue the experience was completely painless and first class. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravellerX
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a short break in Venice but were a bit wary of the time of year given all guidebooks were warning about the heat/smells and general overcrowding. We found this was not the case at all, no smells and generally not that crowded (only around St Marks Square as expected). We picked this hotel as it was a little off the beaten track, located in a residential area of Venice and this proved to be a fantastic choice. Perfect for exploring the city on foot or if you get tired the vaporetto (San Alvise stop) is just a few minutes away. The hotel itself is not a luxurious one but it was clean, comfortable and well maintained. The service was generally very good with helpful (english speaking!) staff at the reception desk. The few criticisms of the hotel I would have is that the breakfast buffet selection was generally quite limited, not really a big choice of hot food. Also self service so tends to descend into a free for all at about 9am! At the time of visiting, the hotel restaurant/bars were closed, but staff were helpful in referring us to nearby restaurants. We dined at Al Bacco nearby a few times, what a gem of a restaurant! The potatoes with minced capers were amazing and generally the seafood was fresh and cooked to perfection. All in all a great short break, if you are looking for a hotel that is away from the tourist hotspots (but not too far away) and allows you to explore the city-then this is an ideal choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Hotel away”
Reviews.Author: CanadianInMotion
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel on the back streets (canals) of Venice. The property is in great shape with attractive rooms and modern conveniences. The people at reception are very helpful and efficient The Residenza was a quiet refuge from all the busyness of Venice. It was exceptionally quiet (courtyard room). The bed was very comfortable. The included breakfast was very convenient and bountiful. I did not care for the coffee but believe you can get espresso if you ask. The hotel was a bit difficult to find at first (we used the Water bus system from the bus station) and although it's not far from the Saint Alvice stop, the location I got from Google Earth was not correct. Make sure you get good directions to the hotel or use a Water Taxi. We walked to various attractions and loved the experience (also occasionally used the Water bus system). I highly recommend this property for those who want an affordable, comfortable, quiet place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: pensare
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay at the Residenza Cannaregio based on the good reviews on TripAdvisor. It is indeed a very pleasant hotel in a very peaceful area away from the hustle and bustle of the busy parts of Venice. A gentle half hour stroll will take you to St Marks Square, or you can take the waterboat which is about three minutes walk from the hotel. Regarding the cost of the waterboat, it is best to buy a three day pass, because at six euro fifty per single trip it can be expensive, whereas with the three day pass you can hop off and on as often as you like. The water taxis are only for people with money to burn. The disappointing part about our five day stay was that the bar and restaurant were closed, and still were when we left. The only explanation the hotel would give was that they were closed due to technical reasons. The hotel has a lovely little garden area and it would have been nice for my wife and I to enjoy a drink there. We were also disappointed that we were unable to sample the restaurant. I know that when people book a hotel they also take into consideration the facilities on offer at the hotel, and in this department the hotel was a disappointment. Residenza Cannaregio is a clean, modern hotel in a peaceful area, but before you book it, check that it can offer the facilities it advertises. I know that our disappointment was shared by many of the other guests at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: mxtrv
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Residenza Cannaregio in a trip to Venice to celebrate our second wedding anniversary. We had a great time, we loved the taste of the hotel's decoration. We have no major complaints about the service or the staff. All the people in the reception were nice and helpful. The breakfast was OK, nothing amazing but good. Maybe the only thing to avoid would be the free trip to Murano. It's a clear tourist trap. They don't take you to the center of the city or a popular port, they take you directly to a Murano glass factory where you can see how the glass is made (nothing that can't be seen in any other factory you step into) and after that they expect you to visit their exhibition room and of course buy something when you haven't even seen any other options in the island. When we noticed this and mentioned we were not interested and would like to go to the island we got a bad attitude from the employees of the factory and were pointed to a back door that led to an empty alley with no direction of where to go in order to get to town. Haha no biggie just a touch of bad taste from the hotel to include this as a 'free' ride to Murano. The area (Cannaregio) is a bit away from the crowded streets and the tourists. At first, the buildings in this area can seem quite worn down however what isn't worn down in Venice. The local feel of the area is definitely a plus. There are nice restaurants in the streets of Cannaregio, they proved to be a good option for dinning in a modest environment but with beautiful views. The quality and reasonable prices of these establishments can be confirmed by the presence of locals. The walk to the Plaza de San Marcos takes about 20-30 minutes, consider 40 to the Accademia and the Guggenheim Collection. Therefore, the location of the hotel proves to be just right in order to keep away from all the chaos and explore this amazing city while walking to the main attractions. If by any chance you get lost on the way, remember that sometimes one of the best things to do in Venice is to just wander the streets aimlessly and see what beautiful sight the city decides to show you. I would definitely recommend considering the Residenza Cannaregio for a peaceful but fruitful visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in Venice, why did I only stay 2 days?”
Reviews.Author: tarter2
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed in Paris, Rome, and Venice and this was the nicest hotel we had. The staff was phenominal. They were very accomidating and made every effort they could to help us. The rooms were clean, spacious (especially for Europe), great ac, mini fridge, bed, and the bath was large. we had a courtyard view which was beautiful and made for some great shots during a rain storm. Lastly, because I believe in looking at both sides, my down fall was the following. We were stuck in Venice with a national transportation strike. It cost us over $300 Euros and 5 hours) to get from Venice to Rome (private water taxi to get off island and then a car rental, gas, etc). I had wished we would have known prior to the day of the strike. **side notes. When traveling from the airport dont spend the extra money on the water taxi. We took the water bus to the Madonna dell Orto stop and it was a 5 minute max walk. Easy to manuever and saved a bunch of cash $12 per person versus $95 boat ride. and believe me we had 3 large suitcases and 3 small bags and we were able to handle after a long trip from the US. as well, we only booked 2 days in venice, Mistake. I would leave a third just to roam and enjoy the city for what it is. Lastly there is a grocery store in Venice if you follow the main street on the walk back from Rialto to Cannaregio. We bought the best Italian bread here (and butter, yum!) and soda (In Europe it is more expensive for Coke than wine) . So we had more picnic lunches since food was so expensive. Have a great trip and definitely stay here. You will enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: AlwynUK
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cannaregio was easy to get to from the airport by waterbus and the location was excellent to explore Venice. We didn't eat at the restaurant but the included breakfasts were good. There is a great choice of local restaurants near the hotel and we tried many of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: docrjj
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and got a great rate on Expedia! We had a canal view room, with good AC (necessary!), and not too small. Staff was outstanding, breakfast was really good (even hot food!), but we loved the peaceful location. There are plenty of great little restaraunts around, quaint Venice streets to wander, and easy access to Vaporetto stops to get to the busier parts of Venice. Then back to peace to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE!”
Reviews.Author: btnusa
Reviews.Content: Very spacious and clean rooms with AC and internet for laptop. But be careful, you purchase blocks of internet time and the time starts at log in and runs despite usage. However, it is worded as if it is usage. So if you buy 4 hrs, the clock starts now and ends in 4 hours, not after 4 hours of internet time. The hotel is a hidden gem. Great bar and garden area. It is in Cannaregio, but not a bad walk to Rialto or San Marco. The hotel has a wonderful guide when you check in with some very nice tips. Never received such a memo before. Very nice touch. Breakfast is very nice too. While in Venice, definitely eat at Anice Stellato! It is a short walk from the hotel on the Sensa. Local place, awesome food, and locals eat here. The Anice staff very helpful choosing from Venetian specialties. The hotel has daily free trips to Murano by taxi (expect a soft sell from the factory). Mini bar with great TV options including pay movies.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cannaregio Marvellous!”
Reviews.Author: DavidMalvern
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel which met all our expectations. The room was spacious immaculately clean, excellent decor, staff friendly and helpful.The garden is a delight and a great place to have breakfast which was very good.We stayed three nights and each day the room was made up with fresh towels and sheets which doesn't always happen. We have stayed in Venice a few times but not in this area before, it is charming quiet but only a short walk from the main tourist areas but you don't need to go very far to find some excellent and reasonably priced restaurants, the best we found was DIANA on Fondamenta de la Misericordia about 10 minute walk from the hotel varied menu excellent quality and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “BEST EVER”
Reviews.Author: bdc911
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we hoped for and more. A great staff, especially David the bartender, wonderful restaurant and beautiful room. Like the other reviews state it is off the beaten path, but still very easy to get anywhere. Half of the fun of Venice is the exploring, and still no more than 30 min walk anywhere. We also found a great local restaurant just a couple of canels from the hotel called Diana. Overall we would diffentiantly stay here again, and hope to very soon!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: emdowns
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern hotel in quiet neighborhood. Close to water bus stop and not more than 25 minutes walk to major tourist points. Good food and helpful staff. A misunderstanding about how the internet rates work, but politely adjusted by front desk. I would definitely choose this hotel again and recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flower1783
Reviews.Content: Beautiful large rooms, delcious breakfast, excellent staff. Perfect location in Cannaregio - 30 minutes walk from St Marks in the 'ghetto' district. Local restaurants good&reasonably priced. Recommend family run Antica Mola for dinner and Dodo cafe for lunch. Trip to Torcello and Burano a must. Alla Testiere restaurant near St Marks square incredible for a special occasion! Do not, however, on any account visit nearby Vesuvio pizza restaurant - terrible food and very rude service.!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DanGro
Reviews.Content: Most beautiful hotel in Venice. Great service, Clean spaceous comfortable rooms. Great breakfast. We loved the inside garden. excellent Restaurant on premises.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowd”
Reviews.Author: MandR54
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated for the Alilaguna Water Bus A from Marco Polo airport and about a 15 minute walk away from the Rialto, 20 minutes from St Markâ€™s. It consists of a quadrangle of rooms set around a pleasant courtyard. The room we stayed in was nicely equipped and spacious. The area is picturesque but well off the main tourist track so nothing like so busy or noisy. There is a restaurant which serves good food and at better value prices than in the centre. We like walking so this hotel was ideal for us. We walked all around Venice during our trip and if we felt lazy could get a vaporetti back to the St Alvise stop which is even closer than Orto.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: oscarelvis
Reviews.Content: Though a beautiful property this out of the way hotel has a real front desk problem. Are three day stay in Venice was nice. This was our third visit so we knew we would be walking and that the Hotel was a ways off of the beaten track, all the better. What we didn't expect was a confrontation at check out from the Hotel manager. On our first day at the hotel we attempted to access the Internet several times--with no success. Not a problem we're in Venice. More important things to see and do. At check out I was told I needed to pay for Internet use. I said fine, but mentioned that the Internet didn't work in our room. The manager asked why I hadn't said something at the time. I told him it wasn't important at the time. He then explained very rudely that he couldn't determine if it was my fault or the equipment. I said fine I wasn't expecting a credit for this, just letting them know. He would nnot let it rest and went off on me about letting them know that there was a problem. I explained again that it didn't seem important and that we were on vacation. Again, he would let it rest and became even more rude and verbally aggressive. I cannot properly explain how rude and aggressive his behavior was. It went on for probably 15 minutes. At that point I began speaking to him in Italian and told him I had enough from him. This seemed to take him by surprise and he stopped badgering me. He gave me the balance of our bill. I paid. Upon leaving with our bags he said "I hope you had a pleasant stay." I would of had we skipped the last part.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: happyrobbo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend stay in Venice. Wanting to stay within Venice we spent a great deal of time considering which Hotel to go for. After much online searching we decided upon the Hotel Residenza Cannaregio. Good online pictures from their own website , location and positive reviews on Tripadviser. We flew to Treviso Airport which on arrival runs a Atvo bus service directly to Venice ,return ticket just 9 euros each, buy ticket at airport on arrival. The Hotel is in the old Jewish sector of Venice , 30 min walk to St.Marks Square. Do not let this put you off as we found walking through Venice's twisty little streets and ally's fantastic. Top tip is make sure you know where the hotel is, ie print a good street map showing you. The Hotel is very well fitted out in a modern style, good breakfast,very friendly staff. We stayed in a Junior suite overlooking a court yard (very nice) we would stay again and recomend to friends. Found the weather much as in England when we went in March. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RitaRochesterKent
Reviews.Content: What a romantic place to stay, very quite and the staff were very friendly. The rooms were clean and spaceous, we overlooked the courtyard which was pretty lite up at night. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a good choice of food. We found the hotel very easy to find after doing some homework before we travelled. If you get the ATVO from Marco Polo airport which costs 3 euros to the Pizzale Roma then either 42 or 52 water bus which costs 6 euros 50 to San Alvise stop and the hotel is a five minute walk. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as this was a special visit for us as we celebrated our 10th wedding anniversay, we will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Martandjan
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Cannaregio is a little bit off the beaten track - about 15 minutes brisk walk from Piazza de Roma, where the bus drops you off from the airport. You can get a vaporetto (42 or 52) if your luggage is heavy! But what a setting! Residential and quiet, it's a peaceful haven away from the tourist areas. The rooms are modern and relatively spacious, but with many original features to maintain the charm. The staff were polite and very helpful, and the American breakfast buffet was pretty good - although no fresh fruit was a minor black mark. Overall, we had a wonderful two nights there. This was our second visit to Venice, and we'd definitely go back to Res Cannaregio again, and are happy to recommend it - so long as you like it quiet and away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: glenbelfast
Reviews.Content: When we started of on our trip my wife and i were a bit weary of the location, However when we finally found the hotel (joy of venice) and found our feet it was a pleasure. It is a bit out of the way if you like to be in the heart of all the hussel and bussle, it was a 5min walk 10 at most away from the major walking route. The walking route was like a big human current flowing threw venice. Back to the hotel, the room was good with lots of space and the bathroom had everything to needed and was very clean. We asked for double and got to singles pushed together but that was ok. One down point was the price of the minibar, i know they are expensive however when its 4 euro for tin of coke, and it costs 42 cents in the local billa supermarket u have to laugh thats 98% profit. All in all not so bad location, great room for comfort and needs (tv, internet connection (fee), tea and coffee and room service). Staff good english and well mannered. Would stay again!!! Enjoy Venice and getting lost like us.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: dhg56
Reviews.Content: Had a large dupex suite on a canal. Quite a lot of space. I really liked the location which is in a very quiet residential neighborhood with wonderful restaurants near by. The trip to St Marks Square is 20-25 miinutes by foot. The vaperretto is also very convenient. I found the staff very accomodating and the breakfast was good other than the eggs. The only negatives were poor lights for reading and thin walls that allowed us to hear the screaming children in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Good with some comments”
Reviews.Author: joop1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel between Xâ€™mas and New Year and I have to disagree with the wonderful comments on this forum. That's why I give a 2 star. I found the location of this hotel perfect: quite, not far from the centre and away from the â€œhustleâ€�. I would recommend it to everyone. I have some comments about the room (ground floor number 102), but these things you find in most hotels: your head hits easily against the suspended TV â€œtableâ€�, there is no adequate reading light, the chair on the bureau desk was too low for writing or reading, pay attention to the shower or the bathroom is wet, the ground floor room corridor is the same as the corridor of the restaurant and breakfast room, so donâ€™t expect quietness all the time â€¦. The worst thing about this hotel for me was the staff. Some were very nice (the porter) but most of them were not nice and not welcoming (except a French guy in the bar). Staff was staring at guests at some times, talking and discussing personal problems in presence of guests in the breakfast room instead of considering guests as clients in a client-friendly way. Last thing, and again, this is very personal, I found this hotel quite â€œcoldâ€� (certainly the reception area) and staff not welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in a nice quiet oasis”
Reviews.Author: pastywhitescot
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, elegant hotel, in the Jewish quarter (Canaregio) which is quiet and a nice refuge from the throng of tourists. I had a suite which is two storeys, with the bedroom upstairs. There is hi-speed internet in every room. Breakfast can be eaten in the dining room (which is clean but otherwise unremarkable) but I prefered to eat in the courtyard. The restaurant on-property is a bit pricey (mind you everything in Venice is pricey) and while the prix fixe was satisfactory I felt they were catering to tourists and was a bit old-ladyish. I had caught a cold by the time I got to Venice so was not motivated to explore, but I imagine there are plenty of charming, out of the way restaruants to explore. The bar is tiny but comfortable and is very modern looking. The desk front desk staff were very friendly and will help you book walking tours or whatever you like. HINT: If you are going to Murano to shop for glass, the hotel will arrange a complementary taxi as long as you agree to a glassmaking 'tour' there which lasts about 5 minutes before you enter the shop to begin the haggling process. They have some beautiful pieces and prices range from 40 Eur for a small piece to thousands of Euros. The higher the price the more leeway there is. I suggest looking in the gift shops by St Mark square, they have a lot of the same pieces from Murano and you will get an idea of prices. To haggle, shrug and look indecisive, they will ask you how much you want to pay, say you don't want to insult them, eventually the clerk will hand you a calculator and ask you to type in a price. If you have a ton of luggage take the water taxi directly there (and pay 60 Euros!), otherwise it is just three bridges walk from the vaperetto stop (route 42 San Alvise stop).

Reviews.Title: “Xmas break at the Residenza Cannaregio”
Reviews.Author: big-dave
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at this hotel 24th Dec - 27th Dec and would definately recommend it. At first glance, the Hotel would seem to be out of the way, tucked up in one of the corners ( so to speak ) of Venice - but we find this aspect appealing. It means that we commute past all manner of sights and scenery - if we stayed around St Marks, it is doubtful if we would make the effort to go out to the far flung corners of Venice. Better to stay outside and travel in. The rooms are great - having said that, we stayed in a standard double overlooking the courtyard and everything was OK till the last night, when a family moved into the room above. The problem being that the rooms on the second floor are the Suites ( which overlook the canal) and Junior Suites ( which overlook the courtyard ) - these rooms have a mezzanine floor with metal stairs leading up to it, which reverberate when people run up and down them. Children being children, they could not resist doing this several times an hour - thankfully, it stopped about 10.30pm. You might think this is churlish, but we werent annoyed about it - it did not spoil our experience of the Residenza Cannaregio, and in fact, we are looking to come back here in 2008 ( Junior Suite though, Hah ! ). There is some building work being done on the site next door ( see the picture of the crane ) - but it would not affect you anyway ( unless you spent all day in your room, huh??). All in all, a very good Hotel, facilities good, staff excellent, location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but perhaps better hotels can be found?”
Reviews.Author: screenname060309
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we traveled to Venice and the fifth city that I had visited in Italy. Therefore my assessment is based on comparison on other hotels in other cities and countries. This hotel has certain characteristics that might be interesting to know. On the positive side, one can mention that the hotel is very clean and the staff very helpful. We had no problem with any issue that could be solved. There were however some details, that new guests should be aware of: I called the hotel beforehand and asked about directions. Coming by Ryanair and landing in Treviso, I was advised to take the bus shuttle to Venice and afterwards take the water bus (vaporetto) line 52. We did this but when we arrived at the station called Saint Alvise, it proved not very easy to find the hotel. I have taken a picture of the map that demonstrates the address to the hotel with the bus stop marked with an arrow. It is actually very easy to find the hotel. Leaving the station and moving straight away form the stop there are two bridges. The hotel is close to the bridge on the right. I am writing this because the hotel area was rather deserted at night and it could be very difficult to find the hotel if we had not somebody to guide us. It could be frustrating since the streets are dark and name of the streets seem to be hidden and incomprehensible. The sign to the hotel is also very small and not at all lit. I met some other tourist having the same problem with other hotels, so maybe it is not unique problem for this hotel. The fact that the hotel is a little bit off tourist track can be both a blessing and also problematic. When you want to come back to the hotel during the day, it would be rather difficult to go back outside again if you are very tired. It is only 5-7 minutes back to the tourist track and not much longer. We got the room with the garden view, but as you can see in the picture here, we did not have any real garden to look at. I have taken photos of the canal that faced some rooms and I really donâ€™t think it is worth paying any extra money for the small canal of water. The water pressure in the shower was very low. I donâ€™t know if this is normal for Venice, but compared to other cities it was really low pressure. The hotel has a very nice breakfast with a couple of warm dishes such as eggs and bacon. Rather good choice of fruits for December. If was satisfactory. As said before, the hotel is very clean. The restaurant was also good, especially if one doesnâ€™t want to go out. The food is really served slowly and sometimes they might make mistakes and overcharge. The price was good compared to outside places with extremely high prices seen in Venice. I would really recommend mixed grill fish. The TV in the room was very small and situated very high. Perhaps a reminder that this should be romantic getaway and not for watching TV! I consider this hotel a good hotel, but as curious person I might try another hotel if I go back to Venice, one closer to St Marc square. The price however may make me reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: eylon
Reviews.Content: Just coming from a 2 nights week end. I've selected the hotel because of the positive opinions found on Trip Advisor and the price (120 â‚¬ breakfast included). Our room on the 2nd floor was a mezzanine type: small den with sofa and TV, a second TV on the upper side. The room was very comfortable and absolutely quiet. Buffer breakfast was good. To reach the hotel, we took the airport bus to Roma Piazza and then walked. Same for returning. This is the cheapest solution if you're not too loaded (cabin suitcase for example). Buy a good city map before you arrive ! I'll definitively recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: araf
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay. Our room 212 overlooked the courtyard and had the bed area upstairs but no bath, shower only. Hotel is very clean and reception are helpful. Soundproofing in bed areas of rooms is not great however with the ability clearly hear conversation and the TV from adjoining rooms. Ate at Algiubagio for two nights and had great meals, highly recommended. Cost 90-100 Euros for two. inc wine/drinks. Landmark for Residenza Cannaregio is a tall crane on the site next door. No building noise however.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: brutte78
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be one of the most beautiful hotels i've ever stayed at. After a long flight from New York, we decided to go to Italy before going home to Holland. We stayed at Residenza Cannaregio, one of the most romantic getaways. Room was clean, fresh linens, and wonderful cafe in hotel. Service was excellent and very kind! I will come back here again. Room was nice and big, and bed was comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Great location. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Art4All
Reviews.Content: I too would go along with just about every other review of this hotel. Having been to Venice before, this has to be one of the best in the city. Sure there are 5* hotels overlooking the Grand Canel but if your budget doesn't quite stretch to over Â£500 a night then go for the Cannaregio. It's in a quiet location but easily walkable to all sites. Anyone who's experienced Venice during the summer season or on holiday weekends (and the tens of thousands of fellow tourists clogging the narrow streets and squares), returning to the calm of the Cannaregio is a real delight. Other benefits are that it's a reasonably short vaparetto ride from the airport. If you want to spend 100+ euros on a one-way water taxi then fine but it never ceases to amaze me that people are happy to pay these exhorbitant and over-the-top charges. Having paid just 24 euros for a more than enjoyable return vaparetto trip to the Marco Polo airport, the thought of getting to and from airports like Heathrow, JFK, Narita etc in the future just fills me with horror. Cannaregio staff are very friendly and helpful. Although the bedrooms (including deluxe ones) are certainly more than adequate they're not quite luxurious and whilst the breakfast, for some, may be a little disappointing, this is really just nitpicking. The hotel is spotless and I couldn't find a fault with it. It was also probably the quietest hotel I've ever stayed in and it was nice not being pestered by staff checking the mini-bar or offering a turn-down service at every opportunity. Never quite sure what that's about anyway? Overall: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: jamaicabound22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Cannaregio for three nights and were completely satisfied with everything about it! The location was perfect for us. We loved the fact that it was in a quieter section of Venice but it is within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, osterias....you name it. It takes a little more time to get to the main attractions of Venice....only 20 minutes. Venice is a great city to walk in so we weren't bothered by the distance....plus, we loved wandering about. The hotel is very easy to find....take vaparetto 42 or 52 to the Sant' Alvise stop and walk the streets and alleys to the right....the first footbridge that you come to you will take you the the hotel's front door. Residenza Cannaregio is a very clean and modern hotel. We had a canal view room which was incredible! We loved listening to the sounds of Venice right outside our window. The bathroom/toilet were clean. The bathtub/shower was sizable and there was a towel warmer for us to use. The room has a safe and a stocked mini-bar which was a little high-priced but we were 'on vacation'! The buffet breakfast that was included in our room price was delicious and always hot and fresh. It is a typical Italian breakfast of fruits, cereal, rolls, eggs, prosciuotto and wonderful caffe. Nice way to start the day. The staff was very helpful and provided us with information that made our visit most enjoyable. They were able to change some currency for us when we found out that the banks were closed. Very accommodating! If I get the opportunity to visit Venice again, I would choose to stay here again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, remote location”
Reviews.Author: FreedomTravel
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Venezia St. Lucia train station after 4 1/2 hour ride from Roma Termini and called the hotel to find out the best way to get there. We took Water Bus line 42 or 52 just a few stops for 6 Euros each and arrived at the San Alvise stop. We didn't see the hotel anywhere, but just started walking and went over one bridge and found the hotel. It is quite hidden and you will need to have very good and detailed directions or you will walk right by it. As we were walking to this hotel at 1:30 p.m. on a Sunday, there was not one single person outside in this neighborhood, it was like a ghost town - totally desserted. But we finally arrived and we checked in and had 2 very nice rooms just as requested with lofts upstairs and living rooms/bathrooms downstairs. They overlooked the lovely courtyard, which is about all this hotel had besides a very small lobby and rooms. We took the 30-40 minute walk to the main part of Venice and shopped along the way - Venice shopping is great and we found amazing glass for everyone back home. For October, it was pretty cold here in Venice, much more cold than Rome or Sorrento, probably 50 degrees at the most. St. Mark's square was impressive, but the gondolas for 100 Euros in the cold wind and choppy water didn't look as "romantic" and special as we had imagined, so we passed and took the water bus home. It was a long journey, probably 45+ minutes back to San Alvise stop, then we had a nice dessert in the hotel restaurant and packed up for the departure the next day. The breakfast was very good, buffett style with toast, eggs, juice, bacon, pastries, fruit - it was just wonderful. The hotel called a water taxi, 100 Euros for 4 people, to take us to the Venice Airport which took at least 30 minutes. It was expensive, but we had planned to do this since we had 7 large bags plus 3-4 small ones. It was just way too much for the water bus (they are not very friendly here). Overall, the hotel was a good value but if I was staying in Venice longer than one day I would want a hotel closer to something - anything. The drawbacks: Hotel is not conveinent to almost anything and there are no restaurants except the hotel's anywhere close. No shopping or anything in this area. The rooms and hotel staff are great, but the restaurant staff is not friendly or helpful in the least.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT! Would most definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bagelflip
Reviews.Content: I went with three of my friends, all college students traveling to Venice for the first time. Getting to the hotel was easy, just follow the directions from the website. The front desk was extremely helpful with everything, told us where to eat, what to see, what to do. The room was huge, we had a loft with a queen size bed and a double sofa bed downstairs. We had a big window that overlooked a small canal, it was beautiful. It was out of the way from the noisy of the busy city, but easy to get to the main tourist spots. I wasn't expecting much because the price was so low, however it completely exceeded my expectations. Whenever I am in Venice, I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not without issues.”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandSteve
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with clean, comfortable room. The staff was fine. Not a rant or a rave about them. The location is a bit out of the way. it was a 60 Euro water taxi ride to the hotel from the train station. It took maybe 10-12 minutes. The water taxi ride to the airport from the hotel was 100 euro. The hotel restaurant was pretty bad (both service and food). The bar was small but nice. The woman attending the bar on our first couple of days was rarely there. I'd have to go looking for her. The last day we had a very nice attentive bartender. Our stay wasn't bad but I'm sure there are better options in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, average room”
Reviews.Author: YokelNorthants
Reviews.Content: We find it interesting that almost all of the reviews are generous when describing the rooms. We found our room of less than average size for the price and we were unable to get a positive result from the air conditioning. It was noisy and had a habit of turning itself off. Having said that the reception staff said that the AC was centrally controlled and showed some surprise when I reported the noise factor to them. It was still noisy when we left, 5 days later, on the 11th October. For that reason I would suggest that you avoid room 227. Our friends room was somewhat larger with AC which was both quiet and effective. Luck of the draw. Everything else about the Hotel was first class, including very friendly staff. Breakfast was adequate, with hot coffee, fresh fruit and usual fare for Italy. Have to agree with others that the "fruit juice" is difficult to identify by taste. Being a four, we found the water taxi's to and from the Airport excellent, quick and good value. We didn't get lost once due to the Hotel map Chiara (She answered my e-mail) sent us some time before we left the UK. We found the position of the Hotel suited us for the obvious reason that it is in a quiet area which happens to have some excellent "local" bars (Dodo's on the corner of Ormesini with Turlona.. 250 yds from the Hotel being one).. The Da Rioba restaurant recommended in a couple of trip advisor reviews we read lived up to expectations.. opens at 7.30pm and is immediately full. No 2553 on the Misericordia. We bought a 72 hour Vaporetti pass which was used mostly late afternon and at night to go to S Marco via San Marcuola on L1. During the day we walked everywhere.. Except Burano which is worth the trip. If you are visiting Venice to see Venice then The Cannaregio is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel you could find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Minhao
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel to stay in Venice. You may find it a bit hard to get there the first time if you do not use a waterbus. We did get lost when we tried to walk there. However, it is really easy to locate the hotel when you get off at S.Alvise station from water bus 42/52. Regardless the location, it is within 5min walking to the south that you can find a street with cheap restaurants and shops (rare in a city like Venice). The hotel's own facilities are newly renovated and only word I can give them is fantastic! The breakfast is American style and is very rich of choices too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Indyrk
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night while vacationing with wife and two small children. Hotel was wonderful, we really loved it. If ever back in Venice, will stay here again. Very quite, very spacious room. Staff very friendly and helpful in how to get around Venice. Close to waterbus stops, which are the way to go in Venice. Room was extremely clean with nice appointments. Cannaregio is a great base to see the sights of Venice, but then escape back to a quieter respite. -RK

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeoDevon
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. The room was great. We had a lounge downstairs and bedroom upstairs. It was extremely quiet ( I hear everything and heard no noise from the room ). The only complaint was the poor breakfast. Very little choice. Cold tea and coffee..........but I was happy because I had slept well. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value !”
Reviews.Author: trottersontour
Reviews.Content: This is a really good, value for money hotel. The staff are very friendly, proffesional and helpful. The location is perfect for all of the must see attractions. Word of caution about Venice, be prepared to get lost, and get a good map as soon as you get there. When you arrive at Marco Polo airport, the most economical way to travel to the hotel is the number 5 bus, which stops right outside the terminal. It will cost you the princely sum of 2 Euros each. Once you arrive, the hotel is a liesurely 20 minute walk from the bus station, but get a map first!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Cannaregio!!!”
Reviews.Author: CC7Bern
Reviews.Content: We spend a long weekend in Venice and stayed at the Cannaregio. The rooms were confortable, clean, with 2 working ACs and 2 TVs and , most importantly for a hotel, very quiet, even though the hotel was at full capacity. The personnel was really nice and helped us find a wonderful restaurant to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The common areas (bar, restaurant, lobby) were wonderfully decorated with amazing paintings (I'm no arts fan), which gave the hotel extra charm. It's about 20 min walk from Piazza San Marco, but seeing the amounts of tourist and noise (and dirt) in central Venice, I was very glad to have stayed at Cannaregio, a quiet and lovely neighborhood. You are only a couple hundred meters from the St. Alvise vaporetto stop, so no problem commuting if you don't feel like walking. Breakfast could have been a little better, but then, I'm a very picky eater so it might be me (my husband didn't complain). I recommend to get a vaporetto pass for your stay. Should I ever go back to Venice, I'll definitely stay at the Residenza Cannareggio again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gurugilly
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and I'm struggling to find anything to fault about it (OK, maybe the pricey restaurant, but you don't have to eat there). It's a restored monastery, so has a central garden/courtyard where you can eat or have a drink. Lots of exposed brick walls and wooden beams etc. We had a canal view room onto a very small canal which was extremely quiet. The room was superb. Staff service was attentive and unobtrusive. In fact the hotel was so quiet at night we were amazed to find how manty people were staying there when we went to breakfast the first morning. An excellent breakfast it was too! It's in a very quiet area (very close to the fascinating, original Jewish ghetto), but only 5 minutes walk from the bustle of the main areas and the Grand Canal, but you will need to be a good map reader to negotiate the alleys and bridges! I'm not one to rave about hotels (check out my other reviews) but this is a real little gem. Beware of the local trattoria though. Our experiences were of good food but incredibly poor service. The busier areas offer better value and service. Incidentally, we saw an outdoor pop concert one evening near the Rialto which featured a funky band whose singer was a middle aged man in a turqouise catsuit, complete with medallion. We were the only people laughing and its gratifying to note that, despite the style of the Italians, our pop music is far superior!!

Reviews.Title: “Photographers paradise”
Reviews.Author: Grendo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residenza Cannaregio for a 4 night break from 17th August to celebrate a surprise 60th birthday of a friend. The hotel was well away from the masses in Cannaregio and was excellent value for money. We arrived by water taxi, expensive but worth every euro, only 15 minutes from the airport and did the return the same way, only 5 minute walk then to the airport itself. Every time you turn a corner is a "Kodak moment" in this most beautiful of cities... At this time of year it is busy to say the least but once you have got St Marks Square and the Rialto out of your system explore by Vaporreto...3 day pass costs 30 euros and is the only way to do it. Next time out of season as it is quieter but it is lovely whenever you go. Good restaraunts all over with an abundance of locally sourced food.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Susareq
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in August 2007. Though we arrived at midnight staff were very helpful when sorting the booking out so that we could go our room as soon as possible. Hotel was perfect, friendly staff, big rooms (and that is awsome for Italy!) nice and big bathroom. Buffe breakfast was quite impressive, sweet area was smaller but delicious all the same, plus the chance of having breakfast on the patio... you can't miss that! It is a bit far from downtown, but it is only 15/20 min walk and Venice is worth the walk. If I ever go back to Venice, it will be to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler19
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cannaregio is the best place to stay in Venice. The entire city is walking distance, so do not worry about being far away from anything. When you arrive to Venice, take the water bus to the stop Saint Alvise, which is super close to the hotel. This hotel is fabulous, clean, stylish, quiet, and beautiful. We would never stay at another hotel, and I've already told my entire family about it. About the location: you are going to go to the tourist attractions anyway, St. Mark's Square, Ponte Rialto, etc. Staying at this hotel gives you a nice break from all of the tourist, who flood Venice all year round. It's so nice to come back and have a night cap in their Garden. We want to move to Cannaregio, the beautiful quaint quiet Jewish Ghetto. This hotel is immaculate. They were so nice, after staying three days, we went to Florence and Verona, and wanted to come back to this hotel in Venice. It was booked for Thurs, so we stayed in Verona and came back to Venice Friday- so as to not risk it at another hotel. They gave us our same room when we returned. All staff except one guy are super friendly. Breakfast is not spectacular, but after staying at four other hotels in different cities in Italia we realized that breakfast is the same everywhere. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Little bit of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: eyelevel
Reviews.Content: In early July my wife and i spent a wonderful time at this hotel which was formerly a monastry , the room we had was a standard which was large and airly opening up on the lower floor to the inner courtyard garden. The room was spacious , clean and presented to a very high standard. The staff were lovely , they were very helpful and had time to chat. The breakfast was 1st class ,a large assortment of hot & cold , and the fruit salad was made up of frest fruit not the tinned stuff most hotels dish up. Although it may seem a long way from the main sites like San Marco piazza it's only a 15-20 minute walk , the big advantage is at night it is lovely and quite. This hotel is a must if you want a relaxing time but also wish to be near everything. Thanks to all at the Hotel Residenza. Jeff & Dawn Cobb

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stonefoxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June. It is quite far from St Marks Sq by walking but easily accessible by Vaparetto. Nevertheless the walk is very enjoyable through the streets of Venice. The hotel is also easy to find following the directions and using the vaparetto, you do not need to spend the extra money to get a water taxi. The Hotel was clean, spacious and well appointed and the staff were exceptionally friendly, especially the bar man David who made some brilliant drinks suggestions - his Rossini is a must. The hotel also had the facility to sit outside in the courtyard for breakfast - a far cry from the hotel we had just stayed at in Rome. If booking I would recommend a Garden View room as the surrounding area is quiet and there isnt much happening on the canals worth paying the extra for. The hotel reception were also able to reccomend a restaurant nearby which was right on the water (Algibagio - I think), with fantastic food and service. This was a great find and the hotel called in advance to book a table for us. In fact it was so good we went back a second night rather than pay the extortionate prices to eat in the St Marks area. If returning to Venice we would definately stay here again. If visiting Venice for the first time I would also recommend the walking tour and the canal boat tour for lots of insider insight. Also a 3 day Vaparetto ticket is worthwhile for no hassle getting around and the Florian Cafe in St Marks Sq is a must for a glass of Prosecco whilst listening to the 6 piece orchestra, pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: haysi_fantayzee
Reviews.Content: Venice is a difficult place to book a hotel at any time of year. Most hotels are relatively small and do not offer all the services you would want. However I can thoroughly recommend Residenza Cannreggio. This is a " boutique" hotel located in the quieter Northwest corner of Venice near the historic Jewish quarter. There is a water bus stop nearby which can take you to either the railway station or out to the islands of Murano and Burano etc. We favoured Burano. The hotel encircles a spectacular courtyard - the building was once a monastery and you can imagine the area once contained the cloister garden of the monks. The restaurant and breakfast room are both located in this area - al fresco style dining in the wonderful Venetian light. Make sure you have dinner in their restaurant, as the chef is quite talented. Our room was twin level and spacious - we had booked a junior deluxe suite facing the courtyard. This was well worth it for the three nights Venice is pretty small and walkable in two days. The main hindrance in getting around is the number of fellow tourists clogging the streets and alleyways. We will never forget our stay and feel this was the best-presented hotel of our 2007 tour.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: worthingtourist
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Cannaregio is a lovely hotel. We stayed there for 5 nights 11 - 16 July 2007. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The room had a safe, mini bar, tea/coffee making facilities and a hairdryer. The hotel is in a quiet but very convenient location. The hotel gave us a very good map which we used continually during our stay. It is very near the St Alvise Vaporetto stop (for the Murano service) or a short walk through the Ghetto to the Giglio stop where you can find some good restaurants. Breakfast was good but would recommend an early breakfast as the dining room got very busy from 9am onwards. I would stay here again, and would recommend it to friends. Getting to the hotel was easy and would recommend anyone getting the Alilaguna from Marco Polo Airport to change at Murano Colonna and get the No. 41 Vaporetto to St Alvise ,this means that you do not have to carry any luggage over the bridge at Fundemento Nove. The dock at Murano for the No. 41 is next to the arrival dock for the Alilaguna. The same applies for the return journey, except you get the No. 42 to Murano Colonna from St Alvise, and the dock is the same. On arrival at St Alvise disembark and turn left & walk a few steps and then turn right (you have no option) continue straight until you come out into a square (Campo St Alvise) where the church is. At the canal turn right (do not cross the canal) and walk to the last bridge, turn left and cross the bridge. The hotel is the first building on your left with the green awning. You will also see the taxi dock for the hotel as that has a green awning overlooking the canal as well. It's no more that a 5 minute walk from the Vaporetto stop. Once you have your bearings you will find a quicker way to the Vaporetto stop but going through the flats, and past the park. Finally thank you to all the people who wrote reviews on this hotel as this helped us make our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: dracae
Reviews.Content: We totally loved our stay in June. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, going out of their way to help us locate lost luggage and to help with directions. The location was perfect . . . away from the crowds of the main tourist attractions, more in a residential neighborhood. It was very easy to walk anywhere we wanted to go, and the St. Alvice vaporetto stop was just a short block away. There are several good restaurants very closeby. The lighting is rather low (in case that is important to you) but the charm, beauty and history of the surroundings more than make up for that. Absolutely would stay again our next time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay with children, easy to get around, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: GarNan
Reviews.Content: After searching the web for hotels that would accommondate 4 people, we were very happy to come across the Residenza Cannaregio. Once we settled in we were able to find our way down the Grand Canal and into the city. Staff was very helpful and the food was great. The Bernhardts from Troy, Michigan USA

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and the people made the difference!”
Reviews.Author: L_N_M
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the price. It was a great price, with breakfast included, but the hotel went way beyond our expectations. The site pictures do not do it justice. The rooms are large, clean and the view onto the canal was wonderful! However, the most important thing about this hotel was the people on the staff that we met. The staff was very helpful. They booked us water taxis, mapped out our days' excursions, were never too busy to answer questions and gave us good suggestions for places to eat. David in the bar was especially helpful. One day we spent the afternoon in the garden with wine we had purchased ourselves during our day's shopping and David brought us munchies and helped us set up so that all six of us were able to enjoy the food in the garden. We stayed at the hotel for six nights. We ate three nights in the hotel restaurant. The food was very good. We ate breakfast there as well everyday to get us going in the morning. Then we were off to see the sites. The Rialto bridge is a twenty minute walk from the hotel if you don't get lost, the square about the same. We did a lot of getting lost the first couple of days. We loved the shopping, but it got old after the first couple of days. We went to the island of Murano. It was interesting to see the glass being blown, but we got stuck in one shop with a salesman that wouldn't let us alone. Otherwise it was a fun day. We also took a waterbus to Burano. I loved Burano. The island was much smaller to visit than Murano. The lace was so beautiful but very pricey. We ate lunch outside. It was lovely. One day we took a water taxi to the Lido beach (the vaperettos were on strike). The beach day was a blast. We rented some lounge chairs and an umbrella. The sand was soft and filled with lots of shells. We also thought the water was warm compared to California, our home. Also, we were lucky to be in Venice during a festival held in San Marco square every year on July 14. There were thousands of people of all ages in the square, as well as, boats filled with people out on the canal. At 11:30 pm they had a huge fireworks display that lasted about 45 minutes. It was incredible! To be in the square with all of theose people standing around... with fireworks going off in the dark sky with music being played in the background and the palace as a backdrop... words cannot describe the evening, it will be an experience I will never forget! Amazing. We loved the hotel. It felt like home for us, the people and the place. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: madhollywood
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for four nights in June 2007. It was a last minute booking on laterooms.com and we did not expect it to be as nice as it was considering the price we paid. It was a similar price to what a 1 star hotel would have been nearer to San Marco. We arrived close to midnight from Treviso Airport and followed the instructions given by a fellow traveller on this website (thank you) and were pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to find. We purchased the bus ticket and three day vaporetto pass from the airport, definately recommended. We couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough. Our room, no doubt one of the basic ones, was roomy (although oddly shaped), the bed comfortable, shower hot and altogether far exceeded any expectation we had of a Venice hotel. Breakfast set us up for the day. Yes the juice is weak but really is that worth worrying about (it's better for you anyway!). Although San Marco is a 20 min or so walk away, it never did worry us very much. If our feet were hurting we just caught the vaporetto. Quite a few times we got lost at night returning back to the hotel but that was more about our own stupidity! The area the hotel is in, is quiet and residential and a nice break away from the crowds of San Marco. Within 5-10 mins walk is a shopping area without inflated prices. The staff are friendly and helpful and will hold your bags for you if you have a late flight. We will stay here again when we return to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MJCM
Reviews.Content: We were met with curteous and efficient service. The room a mini suite was modern and well designed with a/c that worked well. Tasteful bar with great barman, service and craic ( good conversation) included. Garden delightful, felt like the monks were still there in spirit. Walking through a quieter part of Venice a delightful experience after the hussle of the centre. I thought 10 mins walk to grand canal but can see why it could take 30, get a good map.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: scoopy2scoops
Reviews.Content: Only marked this hotel down one star because of the location. If this hotel was less than 10 minutes walk from San Marco then it would be 5 stars no doubt , and also twice the price. We booked through hotelopia with a 10% off voucher code and with 9% quidco cashback this worked out less than Â£80 a night with breakfast for a junior suite with a garden courtyard view. The hotel is easy to find, get the number 5 bus to p. roma stop, then get the 41/51 water bus to S Alvise, walk in land to the next canal turn right, when you reach the bridge turn left over the bridge and your there. The hotel is bright, modern and very clean. The staff were polite and very helpful. The room was on two floors, with wooden beams, a spacious bathroom, comfortable bed and a nice view of the internal courtyard. The air con was effective and easy to control. We didn't use the mini bar much but we did store some of the water we bought from the nearby supermarket there! The bar was a bit on the expensive side, but the service was good. We didn't try the hotel restaurant as it seemed pricer than the nearby restaurants. The breakfast was pretty good, scrambled egg, bacon , toast and boiled egg were the hot choices. There was also good selection of ham, cheese, pastries, fruit , cereal and yoghurt. Coffee was loveley and if you ask them nicely they will do you an excellent cappucino. The only down side was the orange juice was a bit watered down. It's about a 10 minute walk to the water bus stop to get to San Marco. Get the 82 and it takes about 30 minutes. It takes about the same time to walk directly to San Marco. Rialto bridge is about 20-25 minutes away on foot. I would recommend going to Venice in May or Sept. June, July and August are very busy. We went in July and whist it wasn't so bad mid week, the crowds got a bit crazy at the weekend. Would I book the Cannaregio again? Definately off peak, but not at peak time, we found it just a little too far away from the action, whist it was a novelty to be in a quiet area at first, towards the end of the holiday it was beginning to become a chore. In the Cannerigo area make sure you go to the Iguana Bar (particulary on Thursday nights when they have live music) and the Mola Tratorria nearby (great fish). Don' t make the mistake of eating at the restaurant next to the Iguana bar (Diana) this was the worst meal of the holiday. So all in all great hotel, great value, just wish it was more central.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, tucked away hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDAG
Reviews.Content: A monastery that has been converted into a hotel, this hotel is about a 30 minute leisurely walk from the Grand Canal. It is also accessible by a vaporetto that travels around the perimeter of Venice. The rooms are clean and are a good size, and the staff is friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of St. Mark's Square. The hotel has a restaurant and close by are a few restaurants. If you are interested in shopping, however, do your shopping in the areas where tourists congregate. This hotel is located in a residential area.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten tracks”
Reviews.Author: Divehigirl
Reviews.Content: Residenzia Cannaregio is a haven. Very quiet area. We had a junior suite with canal view, very roomy and lofty. Breakfast in the garden was wonderful, as was a nightcap there before going to bed. It's great to come back in this quiet, authentic area after the hustle of St Marks'/Rialto etc. Best way to get there from airport is no. 5 bus and vaporetto 41 to St Alvise, then 2 minutes walking (included in 30 euros 72 hour ACTV pass).

Reviews.Title: “stay near the locals”
Reviews.Author: SHFT54
Reviews.Content: I've seen other reviews saying this hotel isn't convienient, but I disagree, Venice is not that big and the walks are almost all beautiful. It is on the outskirts but you get a feel of Venice you won't get staying in the ultra touristy parts, we enjoyed drinking and eating with the locals who playfully made fun of our poor attemps a Italian. And since it's a little out of the way you should usually get a big price break. If your not a complainer, you will like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Canonterry
Reviews.Content: We were very grateful for the reviews on this site. This hotel is a very good bet. My wife and I had a lovely stay there over 4 days. Good, smart, clean accomodation. The breakfast is modest but sufficient - however, it would not take much thought, effort or cost to improve it. Come on hotel, you've had enough comments about your fruit juice! There are two things it's worth saying: 1. Contrary to some comments, this hotel is not hard to find if you check it out before you set off. The hotel has a good map on its website (google it). 2. It is less than a 10 minute pleasant walk from the hotel to the beginning of the 'busy' sightseeing and shopping area. Yes, it does take longer to get to St. Mark's Square and other sites, but that's a part of the experience. It is great walking back through the peace and tranquillity of the Cannaregio area after a busy day. 3. We took the no.5 bus from the airport (included in the waterbus 24 or 72 hour ticket) rather than the blue bus service or the Alilaguna service which is more expensive and hourly. It was all very straight forward and quick. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Overated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mancs12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fair distance from the other attractions in Venice, for us it was too far out of the area. The Hotel was lovely and clean and the staff were always pleasant. The breakfast is not the best I have experienced, infact I would go as far as to say it was on the poor side. The option of orange or grapefruit juice was available, but it was made from concentrate and that watered down it was hard to tell what flavour it actually was. The television in our room was broken and we had to mention it a couple of times before it was mended. The bedrooms are tastefully decorated but VERY VERY dimly lit. On the whole a nice hotel but too far outside the centre. I have been to Venice before and stayed in a much better location.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: dubliner14
Reviews.Content: A good value, quiet, clean hotel with friendly and most helpful staff. Definitely recommended. From other comments posted on Venice in general, we agree that 1. If travelling from Treviso, get the bus from the airport to Pzze de Roma. 2. The 72 hour vaperetto pass is the best value. 3. Get lost in Venice - it's fun! 4. Bring a brolly or raincoat - just in case! 5. The restaurants in the vicinity and wine bar Jimon are much better than down in San Marco. 6. Watch out for tourist prices for a coffee or soft drinks in the outdoor cafes. 7. Most importantly bring comfortable footwear. Like much of Venice, the hotel was difficult to locate at first. Whilst the hotel is recommended, a couple of caveats: 1. As we were there for 4 days, we had time to spare and could afford 40 mins to get to or from San Marco. However for one on a tight schedule, a hotel closer to St Marco might be preferable. 2. Whilst it might have just been bad luck on our part, the vapereto service from the closest stop was infrequent at best and a consequence, we ended up walking nearly everywhere, even when it rained!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic interlude”
Reviews.Author: GalePeterborough
Reviews.Content: I booked this for a romantic treat for my Husband. The residenza is lovely, it was modern but had character. The staff could not have been more helpful. It was an easy stroll or water bus to all the main attractions. Really great find.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: rts2380
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Venice for her 25th Birthday and booked this hotel based on reviews from Tripadvisor. This is a brilliant hotel, excellent rooms well laid out and the service is brilliant. I highly recommend this hotel, its slight out of central but Venice is so small that the walk is nice and pleasant. The breakfast they served is very different and would certainly recommend it. However, it is accessible mainly through water bus so if your arriving late at night from Venice airport check on the water bus timings.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way”
Reviews.Author: formbyblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights with our friends. The hotel, staff and breakfast were excellent. The piano- bar garden was a suprising treat. The location was convenient for vaporetto, bars and great local restaurants. We all felt that the Caneregio area was authentic and would love the opportunity to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “fab stay at the Residenza”
Reviews.Author: paula1
Reviews.Content: A superb place to stay in a very quiet part of Venice. A converted monastry with a walled garden. Lovely newly renovated rooms and total peace and quiet. Helpful staff, good breakfast and most importantly lovely large, comfortable beds. About 30 mins to walk to St Marks Square but best way to see the real Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: Icarus1
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice in April and it was excellent. But the icing on the cake was the Residenza Cannaregio. A well kept and modern hotel 5 minutes walk from the heart of Venice. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel restaurant is fantastic (ask for the fish of the day - it's freshly caught).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice and this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elames
Reviews.Content: Our CIE Italian Tradition Tour stayed here in April. I was pleased with the reviews I read previously so had little qualms about staying at this hotel. The reviews are all right. This is a great hotel to stay at while in Venice. Yes, it is off of the beaten path, but still very accessible. We loved the peace and quiet of the area at night and longed for it by the end of our tour in Rome. Our room was small but very comfortable, the bathroom was clean and the place was kept very nicely. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Our meal at the hotel restaurant was very filling and very good. I did not like seafood which our group was having, so they gladly substituted other foods for me at a moment's notice. I would go back to this hotel in a heart beat if I ever go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a quiet area of venice”
Reviews.Author: andrew1004
Reviews.Content: Well maintained and helpful staff, wouldn't hesitiate to stay there again. Didn't have the best experience in the restaurant on the first night, although the food was good, it lacked quantity and was expensive. This wasn't helped by the waiters trying to sell off menu. Overall for us good location, much quieter than San Marco area but no too far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Truly magnificent!! Bravo!! Big thumbs up!!”
Reviews.Author: meepus_mcmeepa
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. Don't be deterred by the slightly shabby exterior. Inside is a truly unique, beautiful and modern building. Our generously sized room which overlooked the courtyard style garden had a mezzanine floor which provided a luxuriously spacious feel with traditional wooden beams that characterize this hotel. There was more than adequate wardrobe space so we could keep our belongings organized. The one minor issue we encountered was the lack of light in our room. There was limited lighting which made certain ares of the room e.g. Wardrobe and mirror locations slightly too dark, but this is a small price for such a stunning hotel. We were somewhat suspicious of what the bathroom would be like as there weren't any photos on the hotel website or trip advisor- but we were pleasantly surprised! Although not perhaps not in keeping with the dÃ©cor throughout the rest of the hotel, it was pleasant enough with nice touches such as a heated towel rail and speakers from the TV broadcasting live into the bathroom! The complimentary toiletries were rather special (see photos). The bathroom was cleaned to a very high standard every day. We were very impressed. The reception staff were really helpful and very accommodating by continuously supplying us with maps and looking after our luggage on the day we checked out. The hotel bar had a huge range of liquors and wines. Stick with the wine - liquors and mixers work out rather expensive. The buffet breakfast was very well presented and the waiting staff were very friendly and helpful. Location wise, we thought it was perfect once we figured out the quickest route, it took approx 15-20 minutes to walk to Rialto. We preferred this as it meant we got to explore and see so much more than having the main sights on your doorstep. If you Don't like to walk too far, this probably isn't the hotel for you although the vaporetto stop at S.Alvise is very close to the hotel, walking is the best way to explore Venice and is much quicker than waiting and travelling by the water bus. We will definitely return to this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a great break in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Believe them all”
Reviews.Author: Buteo
Reviews.Content: If you are wondering if all of these glowing reviews are exaggerated, don't. This is a lovely, peaceful, well-cared for hotel with the most friendly and helpful staff, and we liked staying in an area well away from the centre. The Gam Gam restaurant in the ghetto area is great, especially for vegetarians. We were glad we had taken the advice of other reviewers re. 3-day vaporetto passes and directions to the hotel. If you don't know Venice the hotel can be a little tricky to find although the elderly gentlemen gathered for their evening conversations near the Sant Alvise vaporetto stop jumped at the chance to point us in the right direction!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: travellers2NorthEast
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay the Residenza Cannaregio. This is a lovely hotel which was suprisingly easy to find from all the tips we took from other travellers. The hotel is in a nice residential area about 25 minutes walk from St Mark's Square. We are really pleased we chose to stay here and not at our original choice which was just off the square. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, their English was far better than our Italian, and nothing was a trouble. We were recommended some lovely local restaurants- good food at far cheaper prices than round St Mark's and Rialto. Our room was a suite with a canal view and had a mezzanine bedroom with toilet bathroom and sitting room area downstairs. The room was kept spotlessly clean by the housekeepers. The rooms were very comfortable and had everything we needed apart from tea and coffee making facilities - this was the only negative about the hotel. The restaurants we tried nearby were 40 Ladroni, and another family run one on the Misercordia Canal which I can't remember the name of but was about number 2400. The best restaurant we found was at number 2553 on the Misercordia Canal (5 mins walk from hotel) it is called Ostari Da Raobi, the food was fantastic, so good we went 2 nights in a row. It cost about 80-90 euros for 3 courses each a bottle of house red and a glass of prosecco (excellent value). To find this restaurant come out of the hotel and with your back to the door turn left follow to end of footpath and turn left again, at first bridge (wooden one) cross over and you are now walking down Casse Turlona, at the end turn left again - you are now on the misercordia canal, keep walking until you reach number 2553. Overall we are so pleased we stayed a bit further out as we saw so much more and enjoyed the quieter area on an evening.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Keter
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a magical 5 day trip to Venice. The hotel was amazing and faultless - from the outside it looks very unkempt (like all the buildings in Venice) but on the inside it is immaculate so never judge a book by its cover. The service overall was friendly and professional, the food was divine, the breakfast was very substantial with plenty of choice, the smaller restaurant is very intimate and cosy, the rooms are very clean and spacious, the canal view room is peaceful and lovely to look out from and the garden is gorgeous. I read the reviews on this site before booking and am so glad I chose it - I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
