It is easy enough to get to from the airport without lugging cases around, it is very quiet and away from the hustle and bustle but within a 5 minute walk you can be back in the action. It takes about 10-15 mins walk to Rialto Bridge and another 5 mins to San Marco (if you don't get lost - which is more fun). We will definitely return to Venice and this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Residenzia Cannaregio - good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Firefool
Reviews.Content: Very good value quality hotel in an excellent location. Venice is beautiful. The only minor quibble was the room was a bit dark. We couldn't see into the wardrobes after dusk! Which is probably why we didn't display our usual sartorial elegance at dinner.. Very helpful, friendly staff. Decent breakfast compared to many other continental hotels. Restaurant OK but pricey. Plenty of good restaurants a few minutes walk away. Good location by the Jewish Ghetto, full of character, history and beautiful churches. Easy to get around Venice on the Vaporetto (got a 72 hour pass for 30 euro, which included our airport transfer by no. 5 land bus to the Plaza Roma, to pick up the 42 vaporetto to Sant Alvise). We ate in several restaurants recommended on here and also at Gam Gam, the local kosher restaurant, which was good - the mixed Israeli starters are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: marie-rhind
Reviews.Content: my husband and i returned last night from venice and stayed at the residenza cannaregio. we arrived from marco polo airport on the alilaguna transfer boat to fondamenta nove and then took a 41 or 51 vaporetto two stops away to san alvise. we had purchased a guidebook before we left home which had street maps of venice and we found it to be really helpful to find the hotel from the san alvise stop. it was really straightforward to find but i think it may be more difficult without a map. the reception staff were all friendly and helpful. check-in was swift and we were shown to our room by one of the receptionists who arranged for the porter to bring our suitcase straight away. we had booked a junior suite overlooking the gardens, room 224 and it was more than big enough for 2. the bed was situated upstairs in a mezzanine style bedroom and the bathroom downstairs along with a seating area of sofa and chairs. it was kept clean and was comfortable so we never had any reason to complain about anything. we were b&b and there was a good selection to choose from including cereals,fruit, pastries (yum!) and bacon and eggs. a tip if you are going to stay at this hotel, there is a billa supermarket not far if you want to buy some drinks and nibbles for the room or airport when going home. at the front of the hotel with your back to the door turn left and then the first right. follow the path round and you'll pass some garages on the right, keep going and then turn right and it'll be in front of you. it will save you quite a bit of money if you're a family there for a few days. venice is a beautiful city and well worth the wait to visit it. do the secret itinerary tour of the doge's palace and you go places where the general admission ticket won't allow you to go including casanova's prison cell. take a bottle of italian wine and glasses with you to drink on a romantic trip on a gondola. it's an expensive trip but i wouldn't have missed it for the world and know i would have regretted it had i not. we bought a 72 hour vaporetto pass which cost 30 Euro but made getting the vaporetto easy and we didn't have to keep worrying about buying tickets. we got a great deal on the suite for a three night stay at Â£59 a night and took a budget carrier airline from gatwick at a cost of around Â£90 for the pair of us. i can't recommend this hotel enough. we will definately be returning to venice in the future and will book the residenza cannaregio.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Stylish Quiet Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MUNIZO
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel last week during the carnival. We had adjoining rooms for our family of four overlooking the courtyard, very peaceful. The staff were marvelous, polite and helpful. They were very helpful when we were stranded after we missed the vaporetto to the airport (they only run on the hour). We may have missed our flight if they had not given us the name of a good water taxi company who were with us in 15 minutes. The rooms were spotless, modern and very comfortable. When the light went in our bathroom the porter fixed it immediately. The breakfast was lovely and plenty to eat which set us up for the day to come. We particularly enjoyed the location in Cannaregio which was quiet and away from the crowds. However, we were well within easy walking of the main areas and of course the Grand Canal with access to the vaporetto routes. The local area, being mainly residential, gave us a flavor of the real Venice with her quiet canals and alleyways and wonderful small shops, bars and restaurants. All the local owners were friendly and again most helpful. I know our Italian was poor but it helped to meet and greet in Italian before, thankfully, conversing/ordering in English. Arrive in style from the airport by watertaxi, these sleek high speed craft are v smart although expensive but worth it for the full on film star/James Bond experience. (and they drop you off at the hotels canal door) I doubt you will regret staying here Don

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews....class hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MedHel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the views on tripadvisor and weren't disappointed. It's not your traditional venetian hotel but is a very welcoming and comfortable hotel to return to after a long day of walking the streets of venice! The rooms were spatious and clean. One slight problem occured when the occupants above us left their bath running and we had drips through our ceiling, but we were moved and upgraded to a suite. All's well that end's well. The breakfast was what you expect from a hotel such as this. Plenty and edible! The directions given in previous comments were both helpful and accurate. All I would add is that it's definately the right choice to take the water bus (alilaguna line) to fondamenta nove then the 41 or 51 to St Alvise. When you reach fondamenta, turn left and walk over the bridge to find the stop for 41/51. Thanks to all those who commented previously. We'd definately return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulro
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cannaregio is a lovely hotel situated in the quiet area of Cannaregio. It is well located and easily found via the ferry stop at St Alvise. We stayed for 4 nights taking in xmas day and found the whole experience one that we will remember for many years. The room, a junior suite was spotless and extremely well planned with the bedroom in the loft among the ancient former monastary beems. The room was warm, light and airy. The bathroom with bath and shower was excellent too. The staff were extremely helpful and the breakfast excellent with plenty of choice and included eggs, bacon, meats, cheeses, croissants, cakes, you name it! The hotel is close to the Jewish quarter, ferries, and its location encourages you to walk (which is the only way to see Venice). There are a few good restaurants in the immediate vicinity and more just a short walk away. The walk to Rialto is 15 mins providing you don't get too sidetracked by great little coffee places, small bars serving great cheap wine and graet snacks. On our next visit we will stay here again and I recommend this hotel as extremely suitable.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: craig5258
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Marco Polo airport at night and it was a bit eerie getting the water taxi to the main island. Working out which boat to get was the most complicated part but once we managed to get to Sant'Alvise stop (the nearest to the hotel) it was easy to walk to the hotel. Don't put be put off by the outside, you'll soon realise that most of Venice could do with a lick of paint. The reception of the hotel is very welcoming and lives up to its 4 star rating. The hotel staff were very friendly - the reception staff were more than helpful, providing maps and offering advise when we needed it. We booked a superior room via Expedia but were told that we had been upgraded to a suite. A living area with TV and a large sofa, bathroom, separate WC and then a large bed upstairs with another TV. Italian hotel rooms are notoriously small so this was great and we had a view of the canal. With a map and a bit of exploration you can easily make your way to the tourist areas of the city. Walking down a deserted and dimly lit street was strange but felt very safe. You could quite easily walk around the whole city in a few hours. The only downside to the hotel was the restaurant. It was closed for the first 2 nights which was ok; it was winter and the hotel was not very full. When it opened on the 3rd night, we booked a table but afterwards wished we hadn't. They were expecting a large party of people and seemed eager to get rid of us, the food was very average and seemed overly priced. Suffice it to say, we only ate there once so hopefully this was just a one-off bad night. But if I went again, I would stick to the nicer and cheaper restaurants nearby. Overall, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Were our expectations too high?”
Reviews.Author: Mrsheathershaw
Reviews.Content: Having read all the good reviews about this hotel perhaps my expectations were too high and we were a little disappointed with our room. It was very clean and the beds at the end of a long day were very comfortable but the room in general was poorly lit (not helped by all the furnishings and fittings being dark also) and it was very difficult to see in the wardrobes. The lack or any storage space in the mezzanine bedroom was also a problem for us as it meant everything had to be on "display" as there was not even a bed-side drawer. (the only cupboard was full of spare bedding) The breakfasts were OK but not the best and there was no toast! (although the bread on one day was hard enough).We did not eat there in the evening but had 2 fantastic meals at Al Ladroni with excellent atmosphere and service. We had a direct transfer to this hotel and were glad as it is difficult to find even in daylight but it was in a quiet location which in the summer must be a bonus. We had little contact with any staff but they seemed helpful,it would have helped us however if they had put a notice up about the vaparottos being on strike but perhaps they didnt know .

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect.”
Reviews.Author: RorynAlex
Reviews.Content: Having read promising reviews of this hotel on tripadvisor we decided to give it a go and booked a four night stay in November 2006. We weren't disappointed. The hotel was always immaculately clean and tidy, well lit and welcoming. The staff at reception all spoke brilliant English and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was above average in size (we were upgraded to a junior suite upon arrival). It was also neat, warm, comfortable and well equipped with user-friendly air conditioning, a safe and a mini-bar. The furnishings were modern but cosy and the shiny, new bathroom housed a brilliant, powerful shower and an endless supply of bright white towels. Breakfast (7.30 - 10.00am) was a treat (on the one morning that we were up early enough to enjoy it!)with an excellent choice of bacon, eggs, fruit, cereal, pastries and fruit juice on offer. Situated in a quiet area 15-20 minutes walk from the busy city centre, the Residenza Cannaregio's location allowed us to explore quieter, less frequented parts of Venice that we may not have otherwise seen. There are a number of small bars and trattoria's within 5 minutes walk from the hotel and we felt that they catered for local residents just as much as tourists which appears quite rare in Venice! We can't think of a single bad point about this place to go with the long list of good points that a stay here offered. Excellent value which comes very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Directions to this fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie1962
Reviews.Content: Fourth time we've stayed in this lovely hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful. The best way to get to this hotel is get the water bus from the airport across to Fondamente Nove, then drag your cases across the bridge to the next water bus stop and go two stops to St Alvise. Walk from the bus stop straight ahead to the next canal and turn right. About 150 yards down is the Hotel. Highly recommend this hotel - we'll certainly return next year. Julie & David in Bury St Edmunds

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff offering good service”
Reviews.Author: Alanxx
Reviews.Content: We were at the Residenza for 7 nights.We found all the staff very helpful,especially the young man in the bar.Everything was clean and tidy and the breakfast was plentiful with eggs,bacon,cheese,meat,cerials,fruit,yoghurt,croissants etc.The hotel is initially a little difficult to find so ask the reception for directions. The furniture and decor is very modern but the building is very old.We would have liked a choice of "old" or "new" for the bedroom furniture but we had no complaints with the room we had overlooking a small canal.The canal did have a few "builders boats" moving about but they were no distraction and it was interesting to see real life on the canals.Perhaps the only minor complaint is the choice of background music.Italy has some wonderful composers such as Verdi,Puccini,Vivaldi so why is it necessary to have Disco music in the background !!! We found an excellent bar on the Miseracordia canal about 400 yards from the hotel.They do wonderful Apperol(orange flavour)Spritzers for 1Euro60. I think the bar was called Timon's Bar.Also a couple of doors away is a wonderful Trattoria.I don't know the name but it is the one with the frosted glass windows.Try it and see what good,cheap local cuisine is like. All in all a very good experience.If you more than a couple of days then try the Residenza.If you are only in Venice for 1 or 2 nights then you may wish to be nearer the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Staff unfiendly and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: zmn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four days mid October. The area was nice as was the hotel. We found the staff unfriendly and unhelpful. There was no tourist information brouchers or leaflets. When we arrived down for breakfast five minutes late we where sent away even though the buffet was still out and people where still eating.

Reviews.Title: “All great except one little problem”
Reviews.Author: johno.franklin
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was very good on the whole except one issue, as discussed below. Although it is a little away from the heart of Venice, this makes it all the more peaceful, and really its only 5 minutes walk to where you find a lot of restaurants and bars. To walk to Piazza San Marco takes you 20 minutes, and the Vaporetti station is a mere 3 minutes away (take the 42 or 52 to S. Alviso. See the vaporetti transport site [-] for more info). The reception staff were friendly, and provided us with a map which proved very useful - big tip, when in Venice, walking is the fastest and easiest way around. The vaporetti's are great, but they generally take too long if your planning on only going short distances (like to Rialto or San Marco). The only problem we had (stayed in room 235, be warned if your there or next door, room 234) was the next door room's bathroom ventilator exhaust led right into our room. This meant that on the last day we could hear our neighbour conversing about the wedding and places to visit plans for the day at 7:15 AM !!!! If you are given this room, decline it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in working class neighborhood in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith47
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on a Fodor's recommendation and this web site. The hotel was terrific. The building has been recently renovated. We had a very quiet room looking out over the courtyard. There is a market close by and we purchased some food and borrowed a couple of wine glasses from the bar and enjoyed a simple dinner at table on the courtyard. The staff was friendly and helpful, although we didn't use them for recommendations. The hotel is located in a working class part of Venice. There are some construction companies close by selling building materials and welding pipes. However, the people are nice. We enjoyed eating the neighborhood restaurants, which were very croweded on the weekend. The food was good, but not great. However, we had a chance to mingle with the Venetians and their families. It is a short walk to the Grand Canal and vaporettos which will take you to Rialto or St Mark's plaza. You can also walk along the canal through streets that cater more to the locals than the tourists. I'm glad we stayed here and I would stay there again, if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: pirateis48
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks in Italy with our first stop in Venice. The Residenza Cannaregio is lovely, the room we stayed in on the 2nd floor was a beautiful suite with the bedroom room in the loft area. Room overlooked the garden. The area was perfect, away from the crowds and very near family operated restaurants. Major tourist attractions are only a short walk away. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely well-run, exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: Longislander1
Reviews.Content: I was prepared not to like this hotel after our hot and tired party of four arrived one afternoon and was told that our rooms had been given away to a tour group. However, the manager we spoke with did everything possible to make amends. We were put up in a nearby five-star hotel for one night and were then moved back to the Residenza for the remaining three nights, where we were given upgraded rooms with sleeping lofts and canal views. There was also a chilled bottle of Prosecco in our room when we made the transfer from one hotel to another. The porters were extremely efficient in transferring our bags. There are many good reasons to stay here. First, we spent under $300 a night in a very expensive city for hotels. Second, you can see that this place is exceptionally well-run, from the excellent breakfast service to the hustling and gracious porters to the desk clerks who gave us some great restaurant recommendations. Yes, this place is out of the way, but the trick is to get a three-day vaporetto pass for 25 Euros and make full use of that mode of transportation to get back and forth. (A plus is that you're much closer to Murano, Burano and, when you leave, the airport.) Furthermore, it's in a very quiet neighborhood with some good local restaurants, so it's a welcome relief from the crowds at Piazza San Marco and other sites. It also gives you a chance to experience another, less "touristy" side of the city as you mingle with Venetians going about their daily lives. We would absolutely go back to this hotel. It truly is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in residential neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jtbeknott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel prior to a cruise. We were very impressed with the location, service, and quality. We reserved a superior room which was quite large. The bath facility was also quite large for a european hotel. The hotel is in the residential section of Venice which results in a very quiet setting. It's nice to walk amoung people that actually live in Venice. The location is near good local restaurants and near grocery stores. It is also only 2 blocks and one bridge from the S. Alvise vapparetto stop which makes it very convenient for traveling to the busy and noisy S. Marco area. The staff were very helpful and made good suggestions for restaurants in the area. As someone who has lived in Europe and traveled extensively there, I would highly recommend Hotel Cannaregio!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it- away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: alex03
Reviews.Content: Venice was our first stop in Italy and we stayed at the Residenza Cannaregio for four nights. My husband and I took a water taxi from the airport and had only slight difficulty finding the hotel. We simply asked some friendly people who were chatting outside a restaurant and they pointed us in the right direction. We liked this hotel mostly because it was tucked away in a residential area. It was fun to observe people going about their daily lives and hearing all the sounds that came from their open windows. We loved walking back from dinner at night, enjoying the locals who were happily drinking and dining outside along the canal. At no time did we feel unsafe. It was a bit of a hike to San Marco and we frequently got lost in the maze of tiny, winding streets, but Venice is so beautiful that we never minded the detours. The hotel is a nice stroll away from Vini da Gigio, a delicious trattoria (make a reservation!), and just across the canal from Vini is Al Fontego dei Pescatori, where we had one of our most memorable dining experiences in Italy and the best waiter ever. Since we were there on a Sunday, we walked to the church in San Fosca square for mass. My husband, who is Catholic, was really moved by this experience. The hotel staff were very kind and helpful, helping us to make dinner reservations and obtain tickets for the vaporetto when we were leaving. Our room on the second floor was very clean, modern, and comfortable. My only complaint was the loft-style set-up, with the sleeping quarters upstairs and the bathroom downstairs, but we didn't spend much time in the room, anyway. Breakfast was adequate with friendly service. It was a short walk to the vaporetto stop when the time came to head to the train station. We would love to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with Residenza Cannaregio”
Reviews.Author: Rach&Mark
Reviews.Content: Our experience was pretty disappointing, on the whole. We booked Residenza Cannaregio after reading the terrific reviews on Tripadvisor, however the hotel did not live up to our expectations. We arrived by water taxi (70 euro from Piazzale Roma, however it was only 50 euro for the return journey, so be prepared to negotiate!) and knocked on the canal entrance which seemed to be locked and deserted. Once we had checked in, we asked for an iron, to iron a shirt for that evening. Apparently they don't have any irons due to safety restrictions, but they do have a laundry. Unfortunately they do not do any laundry after Friday mornings for the whole weekend, and we checked in on a Friday afternoon, and were checking out on Monday. This meant no ironed clothes for our entire Venice weekend. After some (strong) words with the reception staff, twice, they finally agreed to help us and sent the porter to a 5-star hotel to iron 1 shirt for us. The most disappointing thing was the attitude and response from the staff member - he told us that 'We are not a 5-star hotel' and that we should not expect anything more. Given that we were paying approx. AUS$350 and that the hotel is a 4-star we were appalled. Furthermore, as I was walking out of reception the staff member started talking about us to another staff member, and only stopped when I walked back in there and complained. Our room was 101, the first room from reception and the one that people pass to get out to the courtyard and restaurant. Just outside our window, on the path, there is a man-hole cover (painted to look like cobblestones) that every person steps on along the corrider, resulting in a loud, hollow echo. This became extremely tiresome over the course of the 3 days we stayed there. Additionally, there was a family with a screaming baby staying in a room above us and the old, beamed ceiling did nothing to muffle the noise. Finally, the hotel is located about 20 minutes' walk from the train station, and at least 30 minutes from Rialto. It is a quiet, typical Venetian suburb, which was nice, depending on how much you want to be in the thick of the action. We didn't mind this, however others may prefer to be closer to everything. I think most guests staying at this hotel were about 20 years older than us (i.e. 50 years old), and I think the hotel caters to this market more than the 30-somethings. We loved Venice, however would not stay at Residenza Cannaregio again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Wall100
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend and while it is a little away from the centre of Venice we really enjoyed getting back to the tranquility of this area at night. Some good bars and restaurants nearby that aren't too touristy. The Jewish area is interesting which is very close. It is also very close to the Train Station and by getting the No 42 waterbus to the St Alvise it is a very short walk. Rooms were a good size with a bath which was lovely. Very modern and clean. Nice spacious areas and garden. HIghly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't tell anyone else about this!”
Reviews.Author: otl
Reviews.Content: The more people who know about this little haven, the less chance we will have of getting a room when we return.... The Residenza Cannaregio is becoming the worst kept secret in Venice. It is a little gem of a hotel, some distance away from the main tourist drag of central Venice, but within easy reach of all the attractions. The hotel is only small and has been decorated in a modern style which works well with the ancient structure of the former religious house. We stayed in a freezing December and were thrilled to find that the central heating in the hotel worked more than efficiently. Our fingers and toes defrosted beautifully the minute we got back to the hotel. Although it is in a quiet back corner of the city, the Residenza gives you the feeling of staying in the real Venice, surrounded as the place is, by the residential area of the Cannaregio, and within a short walk of the daily market and local shops. Our only real complaint was that the breakfasts were a little hit and miss depending on the time we arrived - sometimes they were a little short on supplies if we arrived at peak times, and we ended up waiting for replenishment of the buffet. That apart, the place is a joy to stay in, and I'm sure it would be lovely to stay there in summer as the hotel courtyard looked lovely, but was somewhat on the chilly side in December

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel, but you will have to walk!”
Reviews.Author: chapel43
Reviews.Content: It is a shame that so many previous guests have had trouble finding this great hotel. For all future guests I suggest you go to the hotel website at [--], the site is in English and it has a zoomable map!. Also you could try booking the hotel via [--] , They send you a copy of the hotels own map of Venice with the location marked. Getting from the airport: I would ditch the water taxis(nice but too expensive) and do 2 things. 1) get a 24hr or 72hr ACTV pass from the booth in the arrivals hall which allows you onto all the buses/vaparettos etc, they cost 12 euros or 25 euros. 2) get the yellow bus no 5, which is included in the pass (but only costs 1 euro ) and takes 30 minutes to Pl de Roma , or the Blue bus which is not included in the pass and takes 20 minutes for 3 euros. At Pl de Roma you need to go to the canal and get on boat no 42 or 52 which will take 10 minutes to reach the S. Alvise stop. From there it is an easy 2 minute walk to the hotel. So with luck within 60-90 minutes of getting into the arrivals hall you could be in the hotel. Stay with me and I will give you the best walking route from the hotel to the Grand Canal. The hotel is an excellent place to stay, however if you want grand old style venetian hotels go elsewhere (try the Principe, 2 minutes from the train station) The Cannaregio is an ultra modern hotel , bright, exposed brick work, high celings in the rooms, spotlessly clean, with automated lighting in corridors that comes on when movement is detected, the doors have no traditional slots or keyholes, you place your plastic key card flat against the sensor panel to the left of the door and this opens the door. Air conditioning is ultra efficient. Rooms have open wardrobe areas (no doors and no drawers) and are decorated in shades of brown (see picture) witrh recessed lighting, they are quite big, even the single rooms and the bathrooms are well equipped and roomy. The mini bar is not too extortionate, (2 euros for water which costs 1/1.50 euros in the shops, and if I recall about 5 euros for a beer - similar to restaurant prices) Reception staff are friendly and businesslike (black suits and ties, even at 5am!) The breakfast is first class, good quality properly cooked scrambled eggs and bacon and anything else you could wish for, the courtyard area is great if you like eating outside but the interior is fine. The waiting staff were all friendly. The Hotel is in t a residential area of Venice. This means no crowds, and the restaurants are populated by locals and prices are more reasonable. The hotel restaurant is supposed to be very good but not terribly cheap. I found that the easiest way of getting around was to walk the 15 minutes to the train station, which is right on the canal and get a waterbus from there down to St Marks or wherever, the walk is pleasant enough or you could get waterbus no 41 or 51 from S Alvise. Walking from the Hotel to St Marks I made a few wrong turns even with a good map and reckon it will take 30 minutes or so. If you have got an ACTV card take a waterbus. The best way to the train station is also the way past all the local restaurants. go out the hotel door and turn left. At the end, when you reach the canal turn left, and then immediately right over the first bridge (a wooden one) continue down the alley and when you reach the next canal turn left, as you walk down here you will pass a number of bars and restaurants. Cheap and cheerful is Antica Mola 2800 Fondamenta Ormensini, for a more varied menu try Lafondamenta further down the street at 2578 Fondamenta Della Misericordia . However back to the train station, having turned into the street you need to go over the third bridge (a wooden one) at the time of writing there was some repair work going on and the bridge can be identified by orange netting. Cross the bridge and keep right then immediately left into a wide street past the huge pizza restaurant on your left (Vesuvio I think) which joins up with the main street further down. At this junction you can either go straight across following the signs to the S. Marcuola vaporetto stop or turn right over the Guglie bridge and follow the street to the train station. NB if you go left at the junction by Vesuvio, after about 5 minutes you come to a big supermarket (Billa) good for stocking up on things you might need. If you come to Venice in the high season you will be pleased to get back to the tranquility of the Cannaregio, if you come in September / October the city is less busy and a hotel nearer the action might be a better choice. It depends on how much you like walking! But for modern style, the breakfast, the calm and the freindly staff (apparently unusal in Venice, you cannot beat this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel at the far end of Cannaregio”
Reviews.Author: GarryTheEagle
Reviews.Content: Before you arrive in Venice, unless you intend to pay 80 euros for a water taxi, it is important to get a map of the city that includes the vaporetti routes (for example ---) and plan how you are going to get to your hotel. Residenza Cannaregio is a five minute walk (including one small bridge) from St Alvise. The hotel is very modern, clean, bright and comfortable with a fabulous interior garden courtyard â€“ a wonderful peaceful haven far from the hellish bustle that is San Marco â€“ and a fantastic place to enjoy your breakfast in the outdoor restaurant. But this could be its drawback if you prefer to be in the centre with the crowds - if you're walking then allow half an hour to get to San Marco. The hotel's only slight disappointment was in the poor quality of some of the room's units â€“ bland brown plastic covered chipboard, spoiling what otherwise is a lovely, good-quality room. This comment should not detract from the overall high quality of the hotel. This hotel is at the far end of Cannaregio. And I mean the far end. But that would be missing what Venice is all about. You should go to Venice to enjoy half your time being spent lost in its often dark alleyways, among its beautiful squares and climbing yet another one of its bridges. Venice is about more than San Marco and the Rialto. Don't be put off the hotel by its location if you intend to explore Venice's more hidden delights. There are plenty of small, quiet, 'authentic' restaurants within a few minutes' walk as well as the more obvious restaurants, trattorias and pizzerias. Overall, a bright, clean 4* hotel with a beautiful garden courtyard, well away from San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: CITYBREAKERSCAMBS
Reviews.Content: Well yet again TripAdvisor has come up trumps. The hotel was graded as 4* but I think the location, rooms and food make this a 4* plus. Convenient water taxi stop, rooms were amazing - we had a suite with a split level. Had booked B&B and ate one evening in the hotel - very good experience- staff extremely helpful and polite at all times. Short walk into main hub of activity and lots of local restaurants to try ,all of a very high quality. Rather nice to retire away from the touristy areas into a very high quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wellandm
Reviews.Content: I had shortlisted two hotels before I eventually booked Residenza Cannaregio, the other situated more centrally. After reading the reports from TripAdvisor I settled for this hotel and it proved to be a great decision. It goes without saying that Venice (especially in summer) is packed with tourists but this lovely hotel allows you to escape from the crowds in an area of Venice which may be less grand but is certainly no-less beautiful. The hotel was very clean and the staff helpful. We didnâ€™t choose to eat at their in-house restaurant â€˜Al Pironâ€™ but we did enjoy a good breakfast there each day. The area of Cannaregio in the north-west of the city gives you a feel for the real Venice and walking through the streets you mingle with more with locals than tourists, which is greatly refreshing after a day spent battling with the crowds in St Markâ€™s square. Cannaregio feels like a undiscovered gem. I was surprised by how clean Venice was throughout the entire city, you couldnâ€™t say the same for any part of London. The hotel itself is only a short (less than 5 minute) walk to San Alvise vaperetto stop (water buses 51, 52, 41, 42) or a slightly further (10 minute) walk to San Marcuola vaperetto on the Grande Canal. If you want to see Venice then the best thing to do is take a lesiurely walk and return on the water bus at the end of the day. If you want to eat good food in Venice, Iâ€™d recommend either a good guide book or ask at the hotel. The general rule of thumb, which pretty much applies to any destination in the world is the food and the value for money improve the further you are away from the main tourist spots. Youâ€™ll notice that something simple like penne arribiatta will cost â‚¬5-6 near the hotel but nearer â‚¬9-10 around St Markâ€™s. The best meal we had during our 4-day stay was at La Colombina which is only 10-minutes from the hotel. We had another good meal at Antica Mola (a local family-run trattoria) which is closer still. If you choose to eat nearby the hotel you will find that the restaurants can be less glamorous but the food is better. Naturally being in a lagoon, the menuâ€™s are full of fish and on the whole itâ€™s very good. Worst meal of the holiday was on a visit to the nearby island of Lido when we opted for some simple pasta but it reminded me more of the botched attempts of student food from years ago at university. Another thing to be prepared for is that quite a few of the waiters seem to carry a chip on their shoulder so donâ€™t expect outstanding and polite service as you might receive in other destinations. I have no hesitation recommending this hotel. Location was great, it allowed me to see parts of Venice that I would most probably have missed and I would definitely go back there. It helped to make our holiday a very special one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent recommendation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I visited Venice from South Africa in June 2006 and were influenced by your travellers' reviews to choose Residenza Cannaregio as our hotel in Venice, we were not disappointed at all. We loved Venice and all the hustle and bustle but most of all enjoyed getting away from the crowds and staying a little bit off the beaten track. There are some excellent restuarants in the vicinity and with the vaporetto stop nearby, it was extremely easy to find our way around. The garden view junior suite that we booked was very comfortable accommmodation for the 3 of us, the room was spacious and bathroom modern and well appointed, we loved our 5 nights stay. Thank you very much to management and staff for making our stay a very happy one, we will definitely be back again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreecefanOttawa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel in the beginning of June. We found the simple double room facing the garden very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was very clean. We loved the decor and ambiance of the hotel itself. The breadfast buffet was excellent. Although expensive, we took a taxi boat from the airport directly to the hotel. This was very convenient for us with heavy bags. The sites and crowds were within walking distance, yet the area around the hotel was wonderfully uncrowded. I would recommend this hotel. A tip for those relying on the boats - check that boats are available for your arrival and departure!! For our departure we were not able to get any boat at all (taxi or vaporetti) to the airport because of a boat race in the lagoon. We had to carry our bags to the bus station. Otherwise we had a wonderful stay and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Residenza Cannaregio”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaArizona
Reviews.Content: I loved Residenza Cannaregio!!! Cannaregio, the area of Venice where the hotel is, was described as being safe but lacking charm. I had nothing but the opposite experience. The hotel location is absolutely full of charm, quiet, and relaxing peace, especially compared to most of loud, busy, tourist filled Venice. It was still a very easy and quick trip to St.Mark's Square and other sites. The restaurant and garden area was a lovely break during the day. The hotel has a modern, clean, and warm feeling. The staff is excellent, probably the friendliest on our two week honeymoon. The rooms are clean and inviting. Nothing but a positive experience with only good things to say.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: 12212011f
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, located midway between the train station and Rialto bridge. Booked a superior room through roomstogo but got upgraded to deluxe - split-level airconditioned room with sitting room/ bath/ toilet at lower level and bedroom at upper level. All very spacious, tidy and quiet, and helpful staff. Good breakfast but didn't want to dine at the same restaurant - found an informal but friendly place just round the corner (as you exit the Hotel restaurant and turn to the left, it's 30-40 meters away, with tables outside.) Hotel was a 15 minutes walk from train station (with bags). Vaporatto stop is 7-10 minutes away, so you can get around quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “We liked Residenza Cannaregio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel off the web. Directions to it on their site a little incomplete, but found it with the help of another travelers comment. Hotel was very nice, people at the desk friendly and helpful. NIce quiet location. Buffet breafkast very good. Location is at one end of Venice, but my adult daughter and I(I am 80)had no trouble walking to where ever we wanted, including St Marks at the other end of Venice. If you cant walk very much, vaporettos are close by. Would definitely stay there again if I ever return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: boston16
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very quaint. the breakfast was terrific! the room was standard, but overlooking the garden which was nice. The restaurant was very good as well as the bar had a nice atomosphere to it. front desk very friendly only issue was the last night we had Mosquito's in our room and outside the door. when we told the front desk about it, they mentioned that Venice has that problem.. Other than that.. very nice stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vrede
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel!!! We stayed in one of the junior suites overlooking the garden area and thoroughly enjoyed our four day visit. Staff superb from the minute we were lost and guided to the hotel by the receptionist in the early hours of Sunday morning, to our departure. For me it was the relaxed atmosphere and 'nothing is too much trouble' attitude that really made our stay. Can recommend the hotel and surrounding area - the real Venice - far from the 'how many pictures can I get in ten minutes' camera wielding crowds. Do yourself a favour and take a trip there ....

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Pirbrightgolfer
Reviews.Content: This is a really pleasant hotel in an excellent location - a quiet part of Venice away from the crowds but close enough to the main sights. The staff are genuinely friendly and the interior is attractively modern and clean. The only thing it lacks is broadband Internet access but open WiFi signals can be picked up along the canal at the rear towards the East about 15 m and in the Nuove Ghetto. We had a duplex room with a bed upstaris at the rear. In the hot part of the summer a downstaris room would probably be cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Residenza”
Reviews.Author: kiwi6
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at about 11.00pm. It was not the easiest hotel to find, but we had directions from a previous Residenza guest. We did not go too far wrong and when we finally arrived the hotel staff were a very welcome sight. The people at reception were always very pleasant and willing to help. We went to the bar at 11.15pm and downed a very welcome beer - not the cheapest but what the heck at that time of the night you really aren't too worried. The room we had was very large, with a loft that had a double bed and a single bed, downstairs was a sofa double bed. It was exceptionally clean. The area is very quiet and a wonderful escape from the hustle and bustle of the tourist area's. This is a really nice hotel, good value for Venice, and we would certainly return on our next vist.

Reviews.Title: “Quite location local style”
Reviews.Author: Marpleboy
Reviews.Content: A hotel in an old building with a very pleasant modern feel in a quiet part of Venice. Good value resturants nearby and a more pleasant location than anything in the centre - it feels like the real Venice although there are tourists around the locals are clearly in the majority. Staff very helpful, rooms clean and well equiped. Hotel resturant classy if a bit pricey but excellent food. Well worth considering. Some building work underway opposite although this did not cause any problem when we visited in mid May 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Canarregio”
Reviews.Author: praktikalmagic
Reviews.Content: Perfectly placed for seeing the 'real' Venice. Excellent service, food and rooms. Highly recommended. We are going back in two weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Benisit
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff & greeting on arrival. (Particularly as our travel agent had messed up and we weren't booked in until the following month! Luckily there were rooms available and we were checked in quickly as if there was no problem. They contacted the travel agent direct the next morning and this had no effect on our stay whatsoever which we are very grateful for). Spacious room with original beams and skylight feature. Quality fixtures and fittings. Disappointing breakfast but then I'm fussy!! Away from the hustle and bustle approx 10-15 mins to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: livH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! It's in a very quiet, very LOCAL area in Venice, if you like a good walk on your break you'll love this. The staff were really friendly and we were upgraded to a suite totally unsolicited! The rooms are very large with modern decor, big comfy beds, excellent breakfast (included). The only problem is finding the place, print out a map and be prepared to ask for directions. This is no problem because the venetians are really friendly!

Reviews.Title: “4 Star at least”
Reviews.Author: Termc9074
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. Very modern and updated. Great setting. The breakfast was American and good. 1/2 mile from a vaporetto stop S.Alvise

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: wiltshirelass
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited the Residenza Cannaregio at the beginning of February this year. Firstly, what a fabulous time of year to travel to Venice, the weather was perfect, chilly, but clear blue sky every day. The hotel was lovely, quiet, and out of the main tourist area. We didnt find it hard to find at all, a little bit of research, and the entire journey from the airport to the hotel took us little over an hour, and cost us 15 Euros each. If anybody would like directions, please email me and I will happy to help. The rooms were very clean, and were different to any other hotel that we have stayed in. Breakfast was tasty, and varied. I wouldn't recommend that you dont eat here for dinner, there are some lovely restaurants in Venice, especially locally, you will find the quaint, more quiet eateries, that dont cost the earth. We also found a fantastic bar, very close to the hotel, live jazz, and a glass of wine for 1 Euro!! A little different to bars in the San Marco vicinity! TIP: The Residenza Cannaregio brochure also has a street map of Venice, which is probably the best we found. All in all, a fabulous break. I would recommend this hotel highly, and we will most certainly be staying here again given the oppertunity.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful retreat”
Reviews.Author: MiddlesbroughVal
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 4 nights in this lovely hotel while visiting the Carnival. The hotel is quiet, very clean and comfortable. The breakfast is very good and the staff pleasant and friendly. Great location in a very quiet (but safe) area, about 10 minute walk from the Grand Canal. Most sites are within walking distance away from the very crowded areas - walking gives you an insight into the 'real' Venice and see ordinary folks going about their lives in this wonderful city. The hotel will recommend a couple of local eateries which we tried and enjoyed. A word of warning - be aware that around the main tourist sites some prices are expensive and a rip-off !!!! Always agree a price beforehand for the water taxis too !!! I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a moderate price 3 star hotel that is absolutely clean and modern. Beautiful rooms in a quiet area of Venice. They had a great breakfast that was a step above other hotels in this class we stayed at. Great towels and heated towel racks are always a plus. Only drawback is it was a little difficult to find. We had no real problem in the daytime when we got there, but after a couple bottles of wine late at night you may find yourself seeing a lot of Venice as you find your way back. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to find”
Reviews.Author: awc825
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is not the problem. In fact the staff were quite helpful and friendly. The problem was trying to find the hotel. We did our homework before looking for the hotel by asking at the local tourist info desk. The girl working there circled the wrong area on our map - not a good start. Spent hours looking for the hotel and it didn't help that many of the locals didn't know of the address or the hotel! I'll suggest buying a detailed map of Venice as the hotel is in the Jewish Ghetto area and not in the central tourist area of San Marcos.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NomadoUk
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 4 night stay in October and would recommend this hotel. It is quite inconspicuous from the outside but not too difficult to find with the help of a map. Our deluxe suite was clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights with my wife and daughter as part of a round the world trip.The hotel was booked for us by friends but we were really pleased with the choice. The location is in a quiet area away from the tourist bustle and was perfect after a day's walk around Venice (we finished the day with a drink overlooking the courtyard). We did get a little lost getting there and it can be tricky to find but once you have got your bearings (and a good map) it was really convenient for a couple of the water taxis, including the link with Murano. Although on the map it looks a long way from the main attractions, Venice is not that large and we found it easy to walk or use the water taxis (we bought a 3 day ticket) to get to anywhere we wanted. Staff spoke good English and were very helpful. Breakfast was fine although we didn't eat in the restaurant in the evenings as there was plenty of choice around. We had a loft-style room overlooking a quiet canal. It was modern, clean and very comfortable. All in all, a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. Dont believe anyone who says its hard to find. Get a map! Remember Venice's alley ways are like our roads. Modern hotel, we had a large room on two levels. Breakfast was ok. We didnt use the restaurant as there were loads of other places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmyMc11
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 10/7 and stayed for a week. The rooms are hip, spacious and comfortable. We chose the location to escape from the hustle and bustle after long days of exploring. The neighborhood is perfect for mingling with locals. The location is terrific - just a couple of blocks away from the St. Alvise vaporetto once you arrive, then only 15 minutes to Rialto and just under 30 to San Marco (walking). We only took the vaporetto twice - the best way to explore Venice is on foot. The staff are lovely and go out of their way to be accommodating. Finished our evenings sipping on a prosecco in the cool bar or outside in the courtyard. Highly recommend this little gem and will definitely stay there again when we return!

HotelInfo.Name: Residenza Cannaregio
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 3210/a | Dei Reformati, 30121 Venice, Italy
